title: System Developer inom Business Intelligence Finance
description:
**Ansök nu**

*Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens datamodeller för finansiell rapportering? Drivs du av innovation och förbättringar i en tvärfunktionell kultur? Ta chansen att jobba i en dynamisk och lärorik miljö där du är med och bidrar till spelupplevelser i världsklass! Vi söker nu en erfaren och driven System Developer med erfarenhet av PL/SQL, data-arkitektur, migrering från on-prem till cloud samt objektorienterad programmering med Kotlin. Är du intresserad av att vara med på den spännande resan mot decentraliserat data för att möta ökande krav på finansiell rapportering i realtid, läs vidare och ansök redan idag.*  

  

**I rollen får du:**  

* Tillsammans med ditt team ansvara för ATGs centrala rapporterings- och avräkningssystem som hanterar stora mängder transaktioner.
* Vara en viktig del av migreringen av nuvarande databassystem till framtidens lösning och vår resa från on-prem till molnet vilket innebär kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling inom ett högaktuellt och attraktivt område.
* Nära samarbete mellan utvecklare och intressenter.
* Bidra med din erfarenhet och förmågor för att designa och bygga framtidens lösning tillsammans med skickliga och engagerade kollegor.
* Tillämpa relevanta designprinciper inom mikrotjänst-arkitektur vid utformningen av vår framtida lösning för vårt rapporterings- och avräkningssystem.
* Säkerställa datakvalitet, datasäkerhet, dataintegritet samt implementera processer för validering.

  

I dagsläget arbetar teamet med PL/SQL on-prem och dagens funktionalitet ska byggas upp modulärt i en molnbaserad lösning. Du kommer att ingå i ett produktutvecklingsteam med andra utvecklare, Scrum Master och produktägare. Teamets uppdrag är att säkerställa det finansiella flödet för ATGs spelprodukter online och i butik.  

  

**Är det här du?**  

Vi söker en erfaren systemutvecklare med god analytisk förmåga. Då vi är i uppstartsfasen av transformationen från on-prem till cloud ser vi att du är erfaren, driven, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad. Du är en lagspelare som ser kompetensdelning som en självklar väg till lärande för dig och andra. Du förstår vikten av att aktivt bidra till kontinuerliga förbättringar i kod och arbetssätt och att hålla din egen kompetens och förmågor aktuella. Du har god kommunikativ förmåga och uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska. Vi ser gärna att du har en relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom eller motsvarande kompetens och några års erfarenhet av:
  

  

* Agilt teamarbete.
* Systemutveckling eller databasutveckling inom finansiell Business Intelligence.
* Relevanta design- och dimensionsmodelleringsprinciper inom mikrotjänst-arkitektur.
* Avancerad SQL och Java/Kotlin.
* Stora datamängder och transaktionsintensiv verksamhet med höga krav på tillförlitlighet, kvalitet, säkerhet och prestanda.

  

**Meriterande:**  

* Databasteknologier såsom Oracle med kunskap inom PL/SQL.
* Erfarenhet av AWS, Python, Jira, GitHub och Solace.
* Medverkat i en migrering från on-prem till en molnbaserad lösning.
* Data-arkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av automatisering och/eller maskininlärning för att identifiera mönster, anomalier och möjligheter i finansiell data.

  

**” ATG har en framåtlutad och inkluderande kultur med fantastiska utvecklingsmöjligheter”**  

På ATG finns ett stort hållbarhetsfokus som omfattar både kunderna, hästarna, miljön och våra fantastiska anställda. Jag ser på ledarskapet som ett ansvar för att ta fram potentialen i alla medarbetare. När människor växer och vi skapar värde för våra kunder har jag lyckats. Att bygga dynamiska team som driver förbättringar i kod och arbetssätt tillsammans är ett bra sätt att bygga engagemang och stimulera lärande. Det är så vi lär oss och har kul tillsammans samtidigt som vi bidrar till produkter i världsklass. Även utanför jobbet älskar jag hästarna och teknik! Jag har ridit mycket och på hemmaplan vill jag ha tekniken i framkant precis som på jobbet. Annars tränar jag och spelar golf med familj och vänner och har två hundar som hänger med överallt”
  

* **Thérèse Haeggblom Widmark, Head of IT Development**

  

**We are the game**  

I mer än 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
**Join the game!**  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.


Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!


  
Tjänstepension


Work-life balance


Personlig tränare och gym på kontoret


Friskvård


Fri parkering


Hund på jobbet


**Så här har vi det**  

Hos oss är du del av en innovativ miljö och med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar du den bästa spelupplevelsen. Vi gillar att samarbeta och hos oss får du stort utrymme att påverka ditt arbetssätt. Här hittar du nyfikna, nytänkande medarbetare och ledare – viktiga egenskaper för att kunna utveckla och utvecklas. Liksom energi , mod och motivation.


För att må bra är skrattmuskeln lika viktig att träna som alla andra muskler. Både den fysiska och den mentala hälsan skapar balans i livet. Hur vi har det på jobbet påverkar privatlivet- och vice versa. Vi ser det som en självklarhet att ge det stöd och de verktyg som behövs. Ditt val av arbetsplats och arbetssätt är flexibelt och vi lägger stor vikt på självledarskap.


Vi bryr oss om varandra och respekterar varandras olikheter på ATG. Och vi vill att våra kunder ska må bra och ha roligt när de spelar. Vi bryr oss också om sportens välmående, dvs. idrottarna och hästarna - och samhället runt omkring oss. Vi drivs inte av privata vinstintressen utan allt överskott går tillbaka till våra ägare, svensk trav- och galoppsport, något som både känns och gör gott.

title: Lead Developer Integration to Scandic Hotels Group
description:
We want a new Lead Developer Integration to check in with us and partner up with our present Lead Dev!


At Scandic IT/Tech we are on an exciting but challenging journey. We’re on the way to transform our IT department into something modern. With us, you will be part of a team that creates the next generation digital customer journey. If you join us as an Lead Developer today, you will be a key player in our mission to innovate and enhance our integration solutions, driving seamless and secure experiences for our customers.


We offer a role with a lot of flexibility in a fast-paced, collaborative and friendly environment.


**About the role:**

As one of our Lead Developers for the Integration team, you will establish and uphold coding- and integration standards to ensure good integration patterns throughout the IT-landscape. Your main responsibility will be designing technical solutions that align with business requirements, utilizing our integration platform powered by Azure Integration Services. You'll offer strategic recommendations to enhance system functionality, ensuring effective, stable, and secure integrations. Collaborating closely with Developers, Tech Leads, Architects, and business stakeholders, you'll promote best practices and standards across integrations. Taking a hands-on approach, you'll mentor and guide the development team, fostering a supportive environment but also have the opportunity to develop solutions yourself.


This role reports to our Tech Lead for Integration and API.


  
**Who****are you?**


* Extensive experience working with system integration and specifically Azure Integration Services.
* Solid background in .Net development
* Solid background in Agile development methodologies.
* Commitment to lead and coach a team operationally, with a willingness to develop team skills and promote a collaborative work environment.
* A university degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field is preferred.

**About** **Scandic:**



Scandic is the largest Nordic hotel operator with a network of about 280 hotels with 58,000 hotel rooms in operation and under development in six countries. Scandic Friends is the biggest loyalty program in the Nordic hotel sector. A lot of things are boiling at Scandic and we’re looking forward to some exciting and eventful years!



Scandic Hotels is highly committed and proactive when it comes to Diversity & Inclusion initiatives. We are also a responsible corporate citizen and actively engaged in sustainability efforts. We have a long legacy of driving sustainability action in the hospitality industry. With around 20 000 team members, over 10 million guests and 4 million meetings a year – we have great power to drive transformation and inspire change at scale, for a better and more sustainable tomorrow.



Our HQ is situated in newly renovated spaces, of course with a wonderful hotel vibe :) right by Hagaparken on Sveavägen 167 in Stockholm. We love to be in the office but are a flexible workplace and offer a hybrid setup that suits our team members. Join in on our warm and inclusive culture and take part in all our different social activities.


**How** **to Apply:**



We’re happy to see that you’ve made it this far, we can’t wait to get to know you better!



We welcome applications in either Swedish or English.



We are not able to provide any relocation assistance and will therefore only accept applicants already based in Sweden.



Please apply as soon as possible, applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and the recruitment may be finalized before the deadline if we find the right candidate.



Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our website.



We're excited to hear from you soon!


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Professional and personal development


Partner discounts


Family & Friends discounts


Discounts when eating, drinking & staying with us


Flexible office working hours


Competitive pension scheme


  
We know that we reach further when we assent to our differences. At Scandic we want you to be yourself and develop in the direction you want to go, with the foundation of safe conditions and fair agreements. Bring your experiences, engagement and your way of thinking – contribute to a culture where we genuinely care about each other, our guests and our planet. Welcome to Scandic.



Do you share our values?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

... Scandic was the first hotel chain to ask our guests to re-use their towels. Today, the hang-up-your-towel concept is standard at hotels around the world.
... More than 4 out of 5 of our hotels are eco-labelled and the proportion is growing all the time.
... we only serve coffee that is ecologic, and FairTrade or UTZ-certified.
...thanks to our engagement in sustainability matters we have been named the most sustainable brand in the hotel industry, eleven years in a row, by Sustainable Brand Index.

company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Embedded-utvecklare inom telekom
description:
Har du tidigare erfarenhet som utvecklare inom telekom och vill bli en del av vårt engagerade team på Knowit Connectivity? Hos oss får du möjlighet att dels vidareutvecklas som embeddedutvecklare inom telekom, men också utforska nya branscher tillsammans med oss. Vi söker nu drivna utvecklare som vill vara med och bidra till framtidens teknologiska lösningar
  
Om rollenSom embedded-utvecklare inom telekom hos Knowit Connectivity får du chansen att jobba i en dynamisk miljö med industriledande kunder. Du kommer att ingå i ett Scrum-team som arbetar nära kunden, där du kommer att få använda din problemlösningsförmåga och tekniska expertis för att skapa innovativa och hållbara lösningar. Våra team har en härlig mix av erfarenheter och bakgrunder, och vi tror på att aktivt dela kunskap och lära av varandra för att driva utvecklingen framåt.
  
Du kommer att få arbeta med modern teknik inom områden som 5G, IoT och inbyggda system, samtidigt som du har möjlighet att bredda din kompetens inom andra områden.
  
Är detta något för dig?Vi söker dig som har en bakgrund inom ingenjörsvetenskap, gärna inom telekommunikation, elektronik eller datavetenskap, med minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling i C/C++, Python och Linuxmiljöer. Om du har arbetat med teknologier som 3GPP, minneshantering eller DSP, ser vi det som en stor fördel. Vi värdesätter god kommunikationsförmåga på engelska, både i tal och skrift, och om du även talar svenska och är bosatt i Sverige är det mycket meriterande.
  
Vi söker dig som är en erfaren utvecklare med ett genuint teknikintresse och en nyfikenhet för att alltid lära dig mer. Du älskar att jobba i team och ser värdet i att hjälpa varandra framåt. Med ett positivt mindset tar du dig an både små och stora utmaningar, och du bidrar till en arbetsplats där glädje, samarbete och innovation står i fokus.
  
Om Knowit Du blir en del av Knowit Connectivity i Malmö/Lund, som består av flera duktiga utvecklare som jobbar med inbyggda system. Vi tror på vikten av att tillhöra en grupp som har fokus på närhet till kollegor, ledning och kund – samtidigt som vi genom vår starka koncern möjliggör en större trygghet, fler spännande kunder och möjligheter.
  
Knowit är en snabbfotad, rolig och inspirerande arbetsplats med stor laganda. Hos oss jobbar du för att göra skillnad och för att utveckla både vår egen verksamhet och våra kunders. Här finns stora möjligheter att utvecklas, både genom innovativa projekt och genom vår personliga kompetensutvecklingsmodell.
  
Knowit Connectivity är aktivt verksamma i spännande teknikområden så som självkörande bilar / ADAS, infotainment system, elektriska bilar, och i 5G-utveckling inom telecom. Våra expertisområden på Connectivity är inom embedded, cloud och applikationer.
  
Ansökan Vi jobbar med ett löpande urval, så varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag! Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mail. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Elin Zahlander elin.zahlander@knowit.se.
  
Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Software Developers in C/C++, Java, Python or Erlang
description:
Job description
  
Sigma is currently looking for software developers for one of the leading Telecom companies, that stands at the forefront of Agile software development, using methods and principles like Lean and Scrum.
  
You will work in a cross-functional, self-organizing and highly independent team. You’ll be working directly with your Product Owner and stakeholders in a collaborative manner. This requires maturity and a ‘team first’ approach, which we believe is the best way to create great software.
  
The team will design, implement and test the feature, product and system from requirements to production and commercial deployment.
  
Basic qualifications
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

MSc/BSc level in Computer Science or the equivalent level of knowledge.
  
Fluent in English, written and verbal.
  
5+ years of working with development in C/C++, Java, Python or Erlang.
  
  

Preferable experience
  
Mobile Core network knowledge - IP Networks, L2/L3, Routing, 3GPP, TCP/IP, HTTP, UDP, L2TP, TLS
  
User plane and control plane functions
  
Agile ways of working (Scrum, XP, etc.)
  
Good spoken and written English
  
Cloud Infrastructure knowledge such as Open stack, VMWare
  
Build systems (cmake, gnu make)
  
Development on Linux
  
Data communication and networking (Cloud networking, Container networking, Private/Public Clouds)
  
**Containers & Virtualization:** Kubernetes, Docker, KVM, VMWare, Helm
  
Service Based Architecture, Microservices
  
**Scripting:** Python, Perl, shell scripting
  
Experience in working with databases
  
System Test competence; System test automation
  
**Continuous integration development and tools:** GIT, SW build with Maven, Jenkins
  
  

Preferred additional skills, personal traits, experience
  
About you
  
You are passionate about what you do which is obvious from your actions.
  
You have a talent for software development and computer systems. Your love to discuss software development and are comfortable about sharing this knowledge.
  
You are continuously developing your knowledge through experience, as well as reading and experimentation.
  
You love troubleshooting and digging into complex problems.
  
You have focus and ambition to understand customer needs on developed features.
  
You take pride in understanding the whole product and its environment.
  
Software is more than just a job for you.
  
  

We offer
  
Challenging projects - you will work together with a leading Swedish company.
  
A flat organization and a very open atmosphere.
  
Team building - we regularly meet after work and spend time together with our colleagues and friends.
  
Strong employer - Sigma Technology has been voted by its employees as one of the top 5 best employers in Sweden for the past four years.
  
  

Contact
  
For more information please contact
  
Yuliya Alsop,
  
+46 703001338
  
yuliya.alsop@sigmatechnology.se

title: .NET Utvecklare med myndighetserfarenhet
description:
För ett av våra kundprojekt söker vi nu en erfaren systemutvecklare inom .NET.
  
Uppdraget omfattar systemutveckling i viktiga utvecklings- och implementeringsprojekt hos kunden.
  
Ett av deprojekt som utvecklarenkommer att arbeta i omfattar realisering av ett nytt system som används som logg för de analyser som driftanalytikerna arbetar med. Dessutom skapar systemet data för att beräkna kapaciteter i samarbete med de övriga nordiska länderna. I teamet finns utvecklare, kravanalytiker, UX-Designer, lösningsarkitekt, testare, verksamhetsexpert samt projektledare. Kundenarbetar agilt och leveranser sker i sprintar. Systemet som utvecklas ska också möta högt ställda krav på IT-säkerhet.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
Rollen som systemutvecklare i projekt och förvaltningar kan innehålla följande arbetsuppgifter:
  
Design och arkitektur av systemlösningar
  
Ansvara för kravhantering relaterat till objektet
  
Utveckling och test av systemlösningar, både back-end och webb
  
Ta fram eller uppdatera dokumentation i form av krav- och designdokument
  
Ta fram eller uppdatera systemdokumentation
  
Samarbete inom teamet men även med andra delar av organisationen
  
Hantering och prioritering av backlogg i scrum team
  
  

Obligatoriska krav
  
  

**Kompetens och Erfarenhet:**  

Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet på en myndighet under de senaste 10 åren
  
Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i Visual Studio och .Net under de senaste 8 åren
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av front-endutveckling med .Net Razor pages under de senaste 5 åren
  
Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling mot MS-SQL databaser under de senaste 8 åren
  
Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling med .Net Core under de senaste 8 åren
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling med Entity Framework Core under de senaste 5 åren
  
**Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla REST API:** er under de senaste 8 åren
  
  

Mervärdeskrav
  
Deltagit i minst ett projekt där Azure DevOps har använts för ärende- och kravhantering under de senaste 5 åren
  
Erfarenhet av minst 1 års arbete som produktägare under de senaste 8 åren
  
Erfarenhet från minst ett projekt där uppsättning av CI/CD pipe-lines genomförts under de senaste 5 åren
  
Erfarenhet av minst 2 års arbete inom elmarknads eller kraftsystemområdet under de senaste 8 åren
  
Erfarenhet av minst ett uppdrag att ha arbetat med systemarkitektur
  
  

Annat
  
God samarbetsförmåga och initiativförmåga
  
Flexibel och anpassningsbar efter arbetsbelastning
  
Utåtriktad, strukturerad och bra på att kommunicera med alla inblandade parter
  
Ödmjuk och ha lätt för att skapa förtroende
  
Är drivande och arbetar självständigt och målinriktat med fokus på både leverans och hög kvalitet
  
Har en professionell och kundorienterad attityd samt förmåga att snabbt ta till sig ny information och sätta den i sitt sammanhang
  
Konsulten ska tala och skriva svenska obehindrat

title: Backend Developer (Cloud) - App Development Team
description:
We are seeking a passionate Backend Developer with Cloud experience to join our growing team. You will play a key role in enhancing a widely-used shopping app with millions of global users, continuously improving the customer shopping journey and integrating the latest technologies.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop high-quality backend code using Node.js and TypeScript within a Cloud environment.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement features that enhance the user experience, both in-app and in-store.
* Participate in continuous improvement processes within the software engineering function.
* Work in an agile environment, with regular on-site collaboration in Malmö/Helsingborg (1-2 days per week).

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience as a backend developer working with Cloud technologies.
* Expertise in GCP (Google Cloud Platform), Serverless services, Node.js, TypeScript, and Docker.
* Ability to champion new methods and adapt to changing directions based on innovative ideas and feedback.

**Location:** Malmö/Helsingborg (Hybrid: 1-2 days onsite)

Job Types: Full-time, Contract  
Contract length: 6 months

Pay: 350,00kr - 450,00kr per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Ability to commute/relocate:

* 214 42 Malmö: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

* Development: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

Application Deadline: 04-10-2024  
Expected Start Date: 15-10-2024

description:

This role is part of the Continuous Integration Infrastructure team, which develops CI tools for the pipeline, one of the largest software automation chains in Sweden.

title: Senior .Net Fullstack Developer
description:
At NOBA, we’re all about collaboration, curiosity, and tackling tech challenges together. As part of our skilled dev team, you’ll dive into both backend and frontend work, solving problems with people who genuinely enjoy building great things.


We’re currently looking for a **Senior .Net Fullstack Developer**. If you enjoy working with C# and JavaScript/Typescript, and want the freedom to design, build, and own meaningful projects, this could be the perfect fit for you!  

  

**About the role:**

  

You’ll have the chance to work across the full stack, developing new web services, improving system usability, and maintaining existing solutions. You will be trusted on designing and implementing modern web services and enhance system user-friendliness.


We’re big on continuous learning and knowledge-sharing - plus, we believe in a healthy work-life balance, giving you time to recharge and pursue your passions outside of work. Join a team of friendly and highly skilled developers, based in the central of Stockholm.

**Main tasks:**

  

* Architect and develop web applications with a focus on great user experiences
* Build internal tools that make life easier for your colleagues
* Lead the full lifecycle of projects, from concept to delivery
* Integrate third-party solutions
* Collaborate closely with fellow developers in an Agile environment

**We are looking for you who:**  

  

We’re looking for a problem solver who’s not afraid to push beyond the comfort zone and try new things. Strong communication and teamwork are essential, and we’re after someone who isn’t shy about sharing their ideas. You’ll need:

  

* 5+ years of software development experience
* 3+ years in web development with C#/.Net/.NetCore
* 3+ years working with React or similar JavaScript frameworks
* Experience designing complex solutions with a focus on logical design
* Familiarity with Agile Scrum methodologies
* Experience with relational and document databases

Fluency in English (written and spoken)  
* 

**Nice to Have**

* Experience with Azure or other public cloud platforms

Fluency in Swedish  
* 

NOBA is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead. NOBA is an inclusive workplace that strives for diversity - we welcome all applicants regardless of who you are!

 **Practical information:**

  

Start: By agreement  

Location: Gävlegatan 22, Stockholm  

Form of Employment: Permanent employment (6-month probationary period)  

Extent: Full-time  

Working Hours: 08:30-17:00 (June-August: 08:30-16:00)

 **What happens when you have submitted your application?**  

  

The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. Typically, you can expect two interviews before reference and background checks. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.


If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se


We look forward to receiving your application!
  

  

*NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave.*

title: Fullstack Apputvecklare inom Grön Teknik
description:
Bred utvecklare med fokus på TypeScript, React-native och Go

**Om Raymond Solar**


Vi är ett ledande företag inom grön energi med en stark passion för att skapa hållbara och innovativa lösningar. Vår kultur präglas av spjutspetskompetens, kreativitet och viljan att driva utvecklingen framåt. Nu söker vi en driven och engagerad utvecklare som vill vara med och bygga våra digitala tjänster.


**Om Rollen**


Som apputvecklare hos oss kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i vårt utvecklingsteam. Ditt huvudfokus kommer att vara utveckling av applikationer med TypeScript och React-native, men även interna webbapplikationer och verktyg som förbättrar våra processer. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra seniora ledare för att skapa innovativa och attraktiva användarupplevelser.


**Vi söker dig som kan...**


* Utveckla och underhålla mobilapplikationer med TypeScript, React-native, Expo.
* Ta egna initiativ för att säkerställa enastående användarupplevelse.
* Integrera front och backend med GraphQL.
* Har erfarenhet av Linux, Git, Docker, Kuberentes, iOS, Android.
* Identifiera och lösa problem innan de når produktion.
* Använda AI verktyg för att accelerera och utveckla dina förmågor.
* Uttrycka dig flytande i Svenska och Engelska i både tal och skrift.
* Arbeta både i team och självständigt med projekt.

**Hos oss...**


* Kommer du få möjlighet att arbeta med modern teknik i spännande projekt.
* Få möjlighet till vidareutbildning och guidning på områden du vill utvecklas inom.
* Arbeta brett med teknikomställning, både mot kund och internt.
* Möjlighet att bidra till ett mer hållbart samhälle genom ökad användning av grön energi.

**Bra att veta om anställningen**:


Lön: Fast månadslön


Placering: Göteborg


Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse


Anställningsvillkor: Heltid

**Sök nu och bli en del av vårt team som tillsammans strävar mot en ljusare framtid med solcellstekniken som drivkraft!**

title: Software developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


### **About this opportunity**

  

Telecom business is transforming into cloud based solutions with more open interfaces. This drives a great need for increased automation and introduction of AI/ML services in Radio Access Networks (RAN).


The Cloud RAN Intelligent Automation Department is responsible for the Life Cycle Management solution for our RAN. Our vision is an autonomous RAN with a minimum of manual interactions and we will build assurance solutions to always optimize the network configuration for best customer experience. We are growing our organization with a skilled person in software development with special interest in systemization and architecture. We search for a person who is eager to join us in our journey to build something truly exciting!

  

At Ericsson, we believe in teamwork and value open communication. We believe in agile principles, meaning we are flexible, always strive to improve our ways of working.


You will face new technics and methods, like microservices and AI/ML also integrating CNCF components into Ericsson Cloud RAN solution, at the same time as the system architecture and the solutions are being developed. You need to be comfortable to work on unspecified tasks and changing requirements.

### 
**What you will do**

* Conduct requirement analysis to ensure a clear understanding of stakeholder expectations, business goals, and quality standards.
* Conduct impact analysis and feasibility assessment of the requirements. Identify technical constraints and suggest potential solutions.
* Conduct pre-design activities such as driving/specifying solutions of use cases and break-down into smaller pieces
* Participate in design activities, such as analyze, design and code implementation, test development and documentation.
* Participate in integration activities and continuously perform system integration of what’s been developed.
* Follow our features all the way to customer making sure it works as expected.
* Daily collaborate with the other team members to reach our delivery goals.
* Engage and suggest changes to improve our performance.

### 
**The skills you bring**

* A can-do personality that is positive, productive and creative and an ability to plan and drive your own work.
* A team-spirit mentality to reach our common goals and an ability to adapt and respond to changes.
* Excellent cooperation, communication and people skills.
* Large interest in continuously develop your personal competences and skills.
* MSc or BSc level in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or equivalent level of knowledge.
* Experience in system development in large SW systems.
* At least 4-6 years of experience from software development and skills in object-oriented programming languages such as Golang, C++, Java and Cloud Native SW development
* Experience with some of the following: Git, Docker, Jenkins, Spinnaker
* Experience with open source and proprietary cloud and virtualization technologies (Kubernetes, OpenStack, Azure, AWS, etc.)
* Proficiency in English in conversation and writing.
* Knowledge within any of the areas Telecommunication, Cloud Native Systems or Agile ways of working is beneficial.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Linköping

title: Systemutvecklare till AFRY Digital Solutions i Åmål
description:
Jobbeskrivning


Vill du arbeta med andra duktiga kollegor som är lika tekniskt intresserade som du? Hos AFRY Digital Solutions får du möjlighet att arbeta på ett företag som sätter sina anställda först och som alltid strävar efter att ligga i framkant när det kommer till teknisk innovation med hållbarhet i fokus.


Vi har stora möjligheter för dig som har erfarenhet av systemutveckling och trivs i den omväxlande rollen som konsult. Vilket projekt som passar dig bäst avgörs utifrån din specifika kompetens och kunskap.


Kvalifikationer


* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet inom något/några av följande programmeringsspråk: .NET/C#, Java, JavaScript, Typescript, Cloud (Azure/AWS/GCP).
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.

title: Junior Software Engineer Programme (Stockholm)
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you already have at least 1 - 2 years of software development experience but crave for new challenges? Awesome! 🚀 We have some good news for you - we now welcome a whopping dozen junior Kotlin and Scala engineers to our product teams, from consumer products to merchant, to courier and everything in between. We are looking for enthusiastic minds to help us build up Wolt products for everyone involved: 11 000+ employees, 30M+ registered users, 120 000+ restaurant and retail partners, and 180 000+ courier partners. We operate in 27 countries and our team consists of 100+ nationalities and now we want you to bring in fresh ideas and passion for technology – we'll provide the rest!
   

  

 You'll be working with one of our 50+ awesome engineering teams. We work in small cross-functional teams with high ownership, with each team focusing on a key area of the Wolt product stack. Each of our product team members has a say in where we are going and what solutions we implement. We work with a passion, but haven't forgotten how to have fun along the way!
   

  

 At Wolt, we strive to develop our product with the latest technologies and to name some of the most relevant ones: Scala, Kotlin, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, AWS, Kubernetes, Kafka, MongoDB.
 **And now we have opportunities for junior engineers in the following areas:**
**Backend: Kotlin and Scala**
 Hungry to know what Wolt can do for you? Read Kristian's story of how he has grown with Wolt here.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 👉 We are looking for potential to grow, readiness to learn fast, and passion for tech
   

  

 👉 We so require some industry experience, at least 1+ years in software development in Kotlin or Scala (for Kotlin positions, modern Java experience is highly relevant, but we would expect the assignment to be implemented in Kotlin).
   

  

 👉 We would also expect excellent communication and collaboration skills as well as fluency in English
   

  

**Next steps**
 The application period is open until the
 **13th of October, 2024** 
 but apply as soon as possible since due to a high volume of applications we will not consider candidates past this deadline!
   

  

**Next Steps**
**FAQs**
**Do I need to be based in Sweden? Do you offer relocation support?**
 At Wolt, we have a hybrid set-up in our tech hubs and for this position we would expect you to already be based in either Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. We don’t offer relocation support for this specific program so you should be already in one of those countries with a valid work permit.
   

  

**I want to apply; what happens after I send my application?**
 If you are selected for the first round, you will get an invite for the next step by the latest on the following week the application period ends. We will be in touch with each and every candidate who applied regardless of the outcome. As a heads up, the recruitment process includes a home assignment to showcase your skills in practice
 **(the deadline to complete it is 7 days)** 
 , a technical interview, a meeting with your possible team lead and someone else from the team you’ll be joining. We are aiming to make the final decisions within the October-November time frame.
   

  

**I'm a student/ fresh graduate. Can I apply?**
 This is a full-time and permanent opportunity for engineers with some prior experience in the field. If you have some experience and can work full-time, you can definitely apply. However, a separate entry-level internship program (paid, of course!) will follow in January of 2025, read more here, so stay tuned.
   

  

**I'm interested in working with Kotlin but I don't have the experience in Kotlin specifically?**
 Experience in modern Java is highly relevant as well.
   

  

**I’m interested in backend development. Do I need to have the experience in all the technologies mentioned in that area?**
 Definitely not! We are looking for backend engineers in two different technology areas: Kotlin and Scala so only experience in one of these is required.
   

  

**What about frontend, mobile and Python opportunities in this junior programme?**
 At the moment for this programme we are only looking for software engineers working with Kotlin and Scala. However, please feel free to browse our careers site on www.careers.wolt.com/en where you might find something that suits your tech stack and interests as well!
   

  

**I’m not based in Helsinki/Berlin/Stockholm, can I still apply?**
 Unfortunately, for the junior position we’re only considering applicants who are already living in one of the Tech Hub cities mentioned where we do support a hybrid work opportunities.
   

  

**What is the compensation for these roles?**
 The compensation consists of a base salary and DoorDash equity. In Sweden the yearly salary level is around 500 000 - 623 000 SEK depending on your level of experience.
   

  

**When would the start date be?**
 The start date is flexible and negotiable based on your situation.

title: Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on their mobile phones. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year. Our technology powers the world's leading communications platforms.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative team seeking a passionate Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core) to collaborate on our cloud-based communication solutions that are built using the latest versions of C# and .NET Core hosted on AWS using cloud native technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
   

  

 The working model is hybrid, and you can work from Stockholm or Malmo office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create systems that are not only scalable but also resilient, ensuring graceful failure.
* Manage the software lifecycle from design and development to testing and production deployment.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, but primarily with C# and .NET Core.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our development processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional products.


**Requirements**
* Experienced professional in team-based development, deployment, and maintenance of software products in production.
* In-depth knowledge of .NET Core and a deep passion for technology.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and testable code.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Experience working with service-oriented architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes or similar technologies.
* Experience working with AWS.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow developers empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


**Embrace the challenge and join us!**

title: Jr Product Developer to H&M Brand – open application!
description:
**Company Description**
 This is an open application for current and upcoming Junior Product Developer openings for all H&M Brand Business Units and Lifestyle Brands (Womenswear, Kids, Menswear, Divided, Beauty, MOVE and HOME).If you have a passion for fashion and love to do business and create growth, we want to meet you!
   

  

**Our Company**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way.  Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

 The H&M Head Office is based in Stockholm, Sweden, where we design and develop our fashion collections for a wide variety of customers. H&M is a dynamic international workplace where high pace and rapid changes are a natural part of our day. Good communication skills, a flexible attitude and capacity to adapt to changes are essential. We have a sustainable mindset and always seek new ways to improve our sustainable working methods to achieve our goals. Together we offer fashion, design, and services that enable people to be inspired and to express their own personal style, making it easier to live in a more circular way.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Jr Product Developer**
 As a Jr Product Developer you will have an important role in the exciting and complex process of creating products for our collections to be sold in all our sales countries – all over the world. Together with a tight team, you work with identifying and developing collections according to current and upcoming global trends.
   

  

 Your main responsibility is to support the Product Developer, to develop our products for our customers. You will be an important link between Designers, Pattern Makers and Planners throughout the entire process and ensure everything runs smooth! Here you will get the chance to be part of our daily operational tasks, such as sample handling, as well as be involved in setting long-term goals for the team. You work as a project manager in a fast-paced environment where no day is the same
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Preferably minimum one year of experience from product development/ buying
* Education within Textiles/Buying/Product Development
* Result-oriented and a business growth mindset
* Have passion for fashion and products with a good sense of trends
* Having a structured way of working and good at taking initiatives
* A strong team player with great communication skills
* A prestigeless doer
* Curious to learn more and have a growth mindset


**Additional Information**
 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application, including a CV. Interviews will be held continuously.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience, and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Backend Software Engineer (Node.js, Typescript)
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about building scalable and efficient backend systems for headless ecommerce platforms? We are seeking a highly skilled Backend Engineer specializing in Node.js, TypeScript and Azure to join our dynamic team. As a key member of our development team, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining robust backend solutions that power headless ecommerce applications. You will work in an agile team and collaborate with our product managers, lead engineers, and frontend engineers to deliver high-quality, scalable, and resilient software solutions. The ideal candidate is passionate about backend development, has a strong understanding of JavaScript/ TypeScript principles, and keeps up to date with the latest trends and best practices in backend development using Node.js.
   

  

 In addition to the above, your role will involve:
   

  

**API Design** 
 : Collaborating on the design and implementation of APIs that facilitate seamless communication between the frontend and backend, ensuring an efficient flow of data in the headless ecommerce environment.
   

  

**Databases (SQL/ NoSQL)** 
 : Contributing to data modelling and database design, optimizing storage and retrieval mechanisms to align with the requirements of a headless ecommerce architecture.
   

  

**Azure Cloud** 
 : Leveraging your expertise in Azure Cloud services to enhance the scalability, reliability, and performance of our backend systems, ensuring a seamless integration with our headless ecommerce applications.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a Backend Engineer with a focus on Node.js and TypeScript
* Expertise in API design and development, with a strong understanding of RESTful and GraphQL principles.
* Experience in integrating data from diverse sources into backend systems.
* Proficiency in database management (both SQL and NoSQL), with knowledge of data modelling and design principles.
* Experience in Azure Cloud services and their application in backend development.
* Familiarity with headless ecommerce architecture and best practices.
* Familiarity with testing frameworks and tools, such as Jest, Mocha, Chai, or similar.
* Knowledge about Containerization Technologies (Kubernetes) is a plus.
* Good to have knowledge on Centra (headless eCommerce) and Storyblok (headless CMS)
* Should have knowledge on CI/ CD pipelines using GitHub actions.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues, bugs, and performance bottlenecks.
* Conduct code reviews, identify areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Write clean, well-documented code and ensure proper version control using Git or other version control systems.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Additional Information**
**Benefits at H&M**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills, and ambitions are right, please send your resume (no need for a cover letter) as soon as possible.
   

  

 Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Software Engineer - Recent Graduate
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 What you need to know about the role As a Software Engineer in the Unified Purchases team, you will be working on providing a seamless experience between the Zettle by PayPal card processing and Point-of-Sale offerings, and the entire PayPal online library. Meet our team You will join a dynamic team of experienced backend software engineers, led by an Engineering Manager and Product Manager. As part of this team, you'll collaborate with global teams across Zettle and PayPal, contributing to innovative projects with a global impact. Our team focuses exclusively on backend development, primarily using Java and Kotlin to deliver high-performance, scalable solutions. Location: Stockholm, Sweden. Full time position, starting April 2025.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Company Overview:**
 Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 392 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
   

  

**About Us:**
 In 2018, Zettle joined forces with PayPal to go further in its mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. By offering them easy tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow, we are empowering merchants from all over the world to reach their full potential. Our journey in putting an end to ordinary is just starting. Together, we’re extraordinary. Together, we’re made for more and the best is yet to come. Are you in?
   

  

**Your day to day**
 You will be collaborating with your engineering team and product manager to set requirements, design, and implement solutions. Together with your teammates, you'll ensure your code meets quality standards and is successfully deployed to production, enhancing our customers' experience
   

  

**What Do You Need To Bring**
* Engineering graduate-level experience in Java and backend systems. Having a personal Java project or any other relevant work that highlights your skills and makes you stand out is a plus.
* A positive attitude and high energy. We're excited to have you on the team to help us grow and learn together.
* Willingness and motivation to learn, with a curious and inquisitive mindset.
* We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.


 globaluniversitygraduatesoftwareengineering

title: Junior Java Developer
description:
**About The Role**
**The Role:** 
 Junior Java Developer
   

  

**The Team**
 The development team is based in Stockholm and consists of 22 highly skilled individuals with diverse backgrounds, each engineer playing their unique part in serving our global customer base. Everyone on the team shares the responsibility of meeting all functional and non-functional requirements, and you’ll find that the team decisions cover not only business-related improvements but also a wide variety of technical topics such as architectural styles, Kubernetes operators, deployment pipelines, data locality strategies, observability solutions, frontend frameworks and much much more. The team is responsible for a complex system requiring a lot of collaboration within the team and with other parts of the technology organisation and we value learning from each other in order to continuously improve ourselves and the user experience.
   

  

**The Impact**
 OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade. OSTTRA triResolve Margin is our post-trade service that offers an automated workflow for the margin call process as well as a system for managing collateral. Improvement of OSTTRA triResolve Margin has far-reaching effects in this important segment of the financial industry, not only through expanded capabilities of other integrated OSTTRA services, but also directly through operational efficiency improvements and cost reductions for many of the largest banks in the world.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
* Influence the future of a market-leading solution together with highly skilled people across the globe
* Work in an empowered engineering team with people that want you to succeed
* Learn about the financial industry and contribute to the stability of the global financial system
* Expand your technical skill set by working in a modern tech stack


**Responsibilities**
* Actively contribute to the development and architecture of the system to meet new and changing business needs
* Ensure that non-functional requirements are established and met
* Be part of the team taking care of the overall system health
* Engage in continuous learning to keep up with industry best practices


**What We’re Looking For**
* A master’s degree in computer science or a similar field
* 1-3 years of relevant experience
* Excellent communication skills (fluency in English is a must)
* A bold and humble team player
* A desire to work in a modern tech stack including, but not limited to Java, NoSQL/SQL databases, Docker and Kubernetes
* Business-mindedness and a solution-oriented mindset
* An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself, others around you and your ways of working.
* Availability to work at the office at least 3 days per week (mandatory requirement)


**We also prefer if you have one or more of the following:**
* An interest in financial markets
* A passion for technology


**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**About Telcred** 




 Telcred is a startup company based in Stockholm, Sweden, specializing in physical security and proptech. We provide a modern cloud service for physical access control in buildings, integrating with IP-connected hardware from the global security leader Axis Communications. We are well-funded and recently announced a partnership with one of Sweden’s largest real estate companies to deploy our solution over the coming years. To support this growth, we are expanding our development team with two to three talented fullstack developers.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a Fullstack Developer, you will join a small but highly skilled team of developers. You'll work across the full stack of our products, from backend services including data storage, all the way towards the frontend user experiences. Your contributions will significantly shape the product, and if you have a passion for specific areas such as DevOps, security, infrastructure or frontend application architecture and design systems, there are opportunities to take the lead in those domains.
 



  





**About You** 




 You have a strong computer science background and at least 5 years of experience developing commercial software products. You are passionate about coding, produce clean and efficient code, and stay updated on the latest frameworks, tools, and methodologies.
 



  





 You have at least 1-2 years of experience of working in backend with Java and SQL databases, preferably with Spring.
 



  





 Given the collaborative nature of this core team role, we prefer candidates who live within a reasonable commuting distance from our Stockholm office, allowing for occasional in-person team interactions.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




 Join a small but growing and technically advanced company where you can have a significant impact on the product we're building. Our office is centrally located in Stockholm, and we support a flexible hybrid remote/office working model. We offer a competitive salary and a potential path to ownership in the company.
 



  





**Technologies We Use** 




 Our product's frontend includes two mobile apps, two web applications, and their respective REST APIs. The backend leverages message queues to manage tasks across multiple servers, with MySQL for main data persistence and deployments on AWS. Due to each endpoint being controlled by a local processor, our runtime environment is highly distributed. Staging and production services are hosted on AWS, and we use GitHub Actions for continuous integration and deployment. Our primary development stack is Spring Boot Java for the backend with Flutter (app and web) for the frontend, all underpinned by extensive automated testing. We are working with TypeScript and Next.js for upcoming frontend applications. Good testable architectures and code design is something we prioritize.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**At Cevoid, we believe a brand's success is rooted in its customers' engagement. We understand that behind every brand lies a vibrant and passionate community of customers eager to engage, share, and champion their favourite products and experiences. Our mission is to provide e-commerce brands with the tools they need to unlock their communities' potential.** 




  





 Now, we're seeking an exceptional front-end developer to join us on this journey.
 



  





 As a small team, we’re all generalists, constantly picking up new challenges. We’re looking for someone who takes pride in their craft—someone who doesn't just write code but creates thoughtful, elegant solutions. Your experience matters less than your ability to build and your passion for what you do. If you're the type of person who continues to think about solving problems long after the workday ends, we want to talk to you.
 



  





 At Cevoid, our platform is trusted by hundreds of brands daily, with millions of users interacting with our widgets across the globe. You’ll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies while constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
 



  




 What you’ll do
 * Work on all our different apps, from our platform to widgets embedded directly on brands’ websites.
* Build beautiful, scalable UI components and new user-facing features.
* Contribute to AI-powered features that enhance the end-user experience with minimal effort.
* Implement GraphQL mutations/queries and design efficient, user-friendly interfaces.
* Collaborate closely with designers and back-end developers to deliver best-in-class software.
* Build analytics and monitoring tools for both customer-facing and internal use.
* Tweak and optimize performance, particularly with virtualized list rendering.



  




 Tech stack
 * React front-end with Styled components
* Zustand for state management
* Framer Motion for animations
* GraphQL API that provides access to all workspace data
* Backend technologies: Node, MongoDB, Redis
* Development tools: GitHub, Slack, Notion
* Design system with a React component library



  




 What we value
 * You’re a craftsman—you take pride in what you build and notice the small details that make a big difference.
* You have a genuine passion for coding—you enjoy building things, solving complex problems, and experimenting with new ideas even outside of work.
* While we respect that family and personal life come first, we expect Cevoid to be a close second—we’re looking for someone who’s dedicated and invested in our mission.
* You’re someone who keeps thinking through challenges and problems, even when you're not at your desk, and can bring creative solutions to the table.
* You’ve built projects in your free time and constantly seek out ways to grow and refine your skills.
* A keen eye for design and UX—you understand the importance of well-crafted user experiences and attention to detail.
* Strong collaboration skills, with a team-player attitude and effective communication, both written and verbal.
* A solid grasp of JavaScript fundamentals, along with experience in React and TypeScript.



  




 What we offer
 * Startup environment. We're a fast-growing B2B SaaS startup
* Macbook, and other accessories to get you going
* Hybrid work, with a base at our centrally located Stockholm office
* Monthly wellness allowance
* Six weeks of paid vacation
* Working with amazing brands from around the world

title: Software Developer for Ventures and New Business
description:
**About Us**
 Everyone working at Scania is united by a common purpose: Driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. We know that the transport industry must change, and it’s a change we want to lead. Scania’s continuous transformative work within circularity, electrification and autonomy shows commercial ideas, powerful insights and competencies that make real change happen.
   

  

 Ventures and New Business at Scania have a key role in driving the shift and contributing to this vision. We develop and deliver new businesses, supporting Scania’s long-term growth and profitability ambitions. At Ventures and New Business, we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments that strengthen and support our acceleration, driving the shift. We want to engage and inspire our entire organisation to create results together with us, and collaboration and entrepreneurial spirit are part of our culture and what makes us successful.
   

  

 We are today a team of approximate 45+ people and have five ventures. Our office space is very central at Drottninggatan in Stockholm.
   

  

**Job Description**
 A Venture Software Developer is a pivotal team member in new business ventures, responsible for designing, building, and maintaining software solutions that drive innovation and growth. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams to develop scalable, high-performance applications that meet the needs of emerging startups.
   

  

 Reporting to our Tech Domain Manager, you ewill be aligned with one of our ventures while also working closely with other colleagues within your domain to share expertise and best practies.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

 In the role of Venture Software Developer your key responsibilites will be:
   

  

  

* Software Development: Writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code for various applications and platforms, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.
* System Design: Collaborating with architects and other developers to design system architecture and technical specifications that align with business objectives.
* Product Development: Participating in the full software development lifecycle, including requirement analysis, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
* Innovation: Leveraging the latest technologies and development practices to create innovative solutions that provide a competitive edge.
* Problem-Solving: Identifying and resolving technical challenges, optimizing performance, and ensuring robust and secure applications.
* Collaboration: Working closely with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions that meet user needs.
* Continuous Improvement: Staying up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to continuously improve skills and contribute to the venture’s success.


**About You**
 We seek someone with strong experience within software development. It is important that you are a positive influence and a good collaborator as you will interact with a wide array of internal and external stakeholders. Good communication skills are key since you will be interacting closely with business executives both across the company and externally. You are a goal-oriented doer and a team player that loves to see how our business is growing.
   

  

 We also believe that you (requirements):
   

  

  

* Have 5+ years of experience in software development within Python
* Posses front-end capabilities: While back-end is your strength, practical experience with front-end frameworks and languages is a plus.
* Are a AWS specialist, with experience in building, securing, and operating systems using AWS services like ECS, RDS, S3, EC2, and Lambda.
* DevOps proficiency: You thrive in DevOps teams and possess a deep understanding of CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Infrastructure as Code.
* Thrive in in a fast-growing company.
* Are fluent in English.


 What we offer:
   

  

 We offer you the chance to be part of an organisation that is focused on reaching Scania’s targets and truly driving the shift to a sustainable transport system. Joining our team you will get to enjoy the flexibility and agility of a startup enviroment while benefiting from the stability and security of being employed by one of Sweden's largest companies. With the opportunities of the current transformative changes within the transport industry, we are on a very exciting journey. This is the right time to join us!
   

  

 Information and application
   

  

 Questions about the role? Contact linda.rosenqvist@scania.com
   

  

 We are working with an ongoing selection; please apply as soon as possible if you are interested, but no later than 2024-10-31
   

  

 Kindly note that a background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

*Scania is one of Sweden's largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Our mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries. For more information visit Scania.com*

title: Digital Brand Business Developer to H&M Brand Development
description:

* Coach and lead the team to deliver on project goals and creative vision

**Qualifications**
 As a person, we believe you are always an ambassador for H&M and part of leading our company forward where everyone is seen as a leader, both for yourself and the work you do. You actively work to achieve great teamwork where our values are the basis for your work and a natural part of our way of working.
   

  

**We also see that you have:**
* Several years' experience of leading projects within digital development, preferably within fashion and lifestyle
* Experience of working with creative concepts and building holistic brand experiences.
* A few years’ experience of having a strategic role in large complex projects involving many stakeholders
* Proven track record of driving and delivering a brand experience based on an overall brand strategy
* Experience driving projects from ideation to evaluation.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with experience of working with cross-functional teams.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position, starting as soon as possible and is based on-site in our Head Offices in Stockholm.
   

  

 If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English (no cover letter) latest the 7
 **th of October** 
 . Due to GDPR we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**Company Description**
 We want to make it possible for everyone to look, feel and do good. We take pride in our history of making fashion accessible to everyone and our ambition is to always offer fashion and quality at a great price in a sustainable way.
   

  

 Do you want to join H&M on a journey to develop our brand for the future? At H&M, we believe that a strong brand is a prerequisite for a healthy business. H&M Brand Development is a global function with the mission to build brand value that grows the business. We set and drive a holistic brand- and creative strategy and build an inspiring brand experience across all touchpoints and every interaction with consumers around the world. We create and steer brand building marketing. We set the frame and orchestrate the global marketing budget and brand calendar. We support the business with frameworks and tools to empower the regions and business units to grow our customer base.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.
