title: Account Executive
description:
Vi är glada att du överväger en karriär på Kindly! Här är allt du behöver veta om detta jobb. 🥳
   

  

**Om Kindly** 
 🟢
   

  

 Kindly är en av Europas ledande chatbotleverantörer med kontor i Stockholm, Köpenhamn, och Amsterdam med huvudkontor i Oslo. Det som utmärker Kindly och uppskattas av kunderna är dess användarvänlighet, effektiva underhållsarbete samt dedikerade kunduppföljning.
   

  

 Vi specialiserar oss på utveckling av artificiell intelligens och automatiseringslösningar för kundservice och kommunikation. Vi erbjuder en plattform som kombinerar avancerad maskininlärningsteknik och naturlig NLP för att förbättra kundupplevelsen och effektiviteten i kundserviceprocesser.
   

  

 Vår teknologi når över 10 miljoner användare varje månad, och tusentals meddelanden behandlas varje timme på åt våra kunder – företag som Blocket, Filmstaden, Norwegian Air, Lindex, Voi, Hertz, Kicks och Kahoot, för att nämna några.
   

  

**Om rollen 👋**
 Vi söker nu en Account Executive här i Sverige, som har goda resultat att visa till, och en passion för försäljning. Med din erfarenhet och expertis kommer du att vara med och lyfta säljorganisationen Kindly. Du vill arbeta på en marknad där Kindly är en betydande aktör, men med mycket outnyttjad potential.
   

  

 Vi tror att en av de viktigaste faktorerna för att lyckas i ett jobb är att du trivs på arbetsplatsen. Därför är arbetsmiljön det viktigaste här på Kindly. Här jobbar vi alla mot gemensamma mål, och alla vill varandras bästa. Vi vill att du ska ha kul på jobbet! Det är därför viktigt för oss när vi anställer nya människor att de delar denna filosofi.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra** 
 📋
   

  

 Som en
 **Account Executive** 
 kommer ditt jobb att vara att:
   

  

* Arbeta mot potentiella kunder inom mid & enterprise-segmentet.
* Boka och genomför möten med potentiella kunder, vanligtvis supportchefer och IT-direktörer (Det är ett stort plus om du har sålt till den här typen av beslutsfattare tidigare, men inget krav).
* Bygga samt bearbeta en sales pipeline, med allt administrativt arbete som följer med.
* Äga hela försäljningsprocessen, från viss prospektering, mötesbokning till avtalsförhandlingar. (Med god stöttning från SDR)


**Önskade kvalifikationer ✍️**
* Du har minst 3-5 års erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning inom SaaS-branschen. (Gärna inom kundservice-segmentet)
* Du är van att arbeta med beslutsfattare i större företag från olika branscher i Sverige eller Norden.
* Erfarenhet av outbound sales.
* Du talar flytande svenska och bra engelska.


**Vi tror att det här är du 🏌️**
* Du vet precis vad som krävs för att komma i kontakt med de rätta personerna i företag för att få in dem som nya kunder. Du har resultat som bevisar att du har klarat detta tidigare i din karriär.
* Du kan arbeta självständigt i en fartfylld och konkurrenskraftig säljmiljö.
* Du vill bidra till att arbetsmiljön i Kindly fortsätter att vara så bra som den är.
* Du vill bygga en karriär i vårt företag, och har ambitioner att utvecklas vidare internt. Vi har skapat en karriärstege bara för att du ska utvecklas i ditt jobb.
* Du kan hjälpa till att vidareutveckla resten av teamet med dina erfarenheter.


**Förmåner på Kindly 🛍️**
* En konkurrenskraftig lön, och möjlighet att utvecklas i ett snabbväxande Tech-företag med ambitioner om internationell tillväxt. Förhoppningsvis kommer ni att bli lika exalterade över detta som vi!
* Möjligheten att växa, både på ett personligt plan men också professionellt. Du kommer att få bra stöd från både erfarna chefer och kollegor.
* En nyckelposition i Kindlys vidare satsning i Sverige, i ett energiskt och passionerat säljteam.
* Både bra utbildning och coachning inom försäljning och marknadsföring av vår teknologi, som faktiskt finns i en av de snabbast växande branscherna både nu och i framtiden.
* En fantastisk arbetsmiljö där vänskap både på och utanför arbetet hela tiden skapas. Oavsett om det är på en AW, över en pingismatch i vårt entertainment room eller över måndagskaffen klockan 08.05.


 That's it for now.
 **Good luck** 
 with your application process.🤞

title: Sales Consultant
description:
Build a better world (together with us)!
 



  





 We are a green tech company, with extensive experience in sustainable services. We deliver two platforms, a world-leading marketplace for connecting architects and manufacturers (bimobject.com) and the unique sustainability platform Prodikt (www.prodikt.com), focusing on stakeholders and actors in the construction and property sector. To fuel these platforms, we develop BIM objects and EPDs. Additionally, we provide an LCA software that integrates unique blockchain technology, bringing supply chain and operations together in an LCA context.
 



  





 Together with us, you will make a difference – both for our clients and the planet. We offer you the unique opportunity to be part of a small team within a global company of 150 employees. If that isn’t the perfect mix of agility and stability, we don’t know what is. Welcome to a workplace where we believe in inclusion with open and honest conversations, where we always support each other and together quickly adapt and raise our offering to the next level. We love new ideas and perspectives and strongly encourage people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to apply.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




  





*We are looking for a social, self-motivated, energetic Sales Consultant with a passion for building long-lasting relations with a broad variety of customers within the building industry. You are an outgoing people’s-person who does not hesitate to take action and wants to be a part of our society’s green transition. You thrive in a small team where you collaborate with your peers to create the best possible solutions.* 




  





**More about your experience** 




  




* Are curious about the SaaS industry and have previous experience within sales, support or service of any kind
* Not afraid of picking up the phone and try other strategies to create new sales opportunities
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English. Additional European languages are a bonus.



  





**Extra awesome** 




  




* Demonstrated skills in inbound and outbound prospecting
* Prior experience of sales in a B2B company, preferably for a SaaS Solution
* Have some experience in the building industry and its complexity



  





**As our new Sales Consultant, you will…** 




  





 You will be part of a fun, entrepreneurial, and ambitious team from day one, in which you will play a key role. The market is moving fast and we need a colleague who can develop fast and drive sales from A-Z. You will work towards the Swedish market.
 



  





 Your responsibilities and tasks:
 



  




* Close collaboration with your immediate team within project solutions as well as the Nordic commercial team in order to drive the development of your market
* Actively work with strategic prospecting
* Drive the entire sales cycle from initial engagement to closed sales and create your own engaging sales pipeline
* Engage in sustainability and real-estate event and network with our stakeholders
* Educate potential customers on our platform Prodikt
* Travel to exhibitions or other offices within BIMobject



  





**Practicalities** 




  





 This is a hybrid position. Your manager is located in Gävle and your team in Malmö and Stockholm so you can be based in any of those locations.
 



 We know that applying for a job can be intimidating and that applicants rarely meet (or feel that they meet) every single criterion. We also recognize that many skills and backgrounds can contribute to success in this role. So, if this role looks like a great next step for you, please apply even if you can’t “check every box.”
 



  





**What we offer our employees** 




  





 The start-up mentality is an important part of who we are, meaning that we never want to stop experimenting and learning, and we love to see our people grow. We prioritise continuous personal development by investing in our employees. Finally, and maybe most importantly, we want all our employees to have the opportunity to shape their work and have their say in how we drive our company forward. It all comes down to our core values:
 **Raise it, Do it, Together** 
 . Does it match who you are and where you want to work? Then we are excited to hear from you!
 



  





 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and our customers. We value this deeply, and we encourage everyone to come and be a part of changing the way the industry works.
 



  





 Applications will be reviewed continuously, so please send yours as soon as possible but no later than
 **24th of October.** 




  




* We can’t wait to meet you!

title: Cybersecurity Architect - Product Ownership
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 As a Detection and Response Technical Architect, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining technical solutions to detect and respond to cybersecurity incidents within an organization. Your role will involve translating security requirements into technical designs, configuring security tools, and providing ongoing support to ensure the effectiveness of detection and response mechanisms.
   

  

 With this new role we want to drive our transformation for a security tech stack that is in line with Electrolux IT landscape and our cloud strategy.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Technical Solution Design for detecting and responding to cybersecurity incidents, ensuring alignment with security requirements and best practices.
* Tool Configuration and optimization for security tools such as SIEMs XDRs, Attack surface and other detection and response technologies to enhance threat detection and incident response capabilities.
* Be close and contribute as Incident Response Support. Provide technical support during security incidents, working closely with incident response teams to identify, contain, and remediate security threats.
* Develop the work for Integration on security tools and technologies with existing systems and applications to streamline detection and response processes and enhance overall security posture.
* Monitor the performance of security solutions, analyze security logs and alerts, and make recommendations for improvements to enhance detection accuracy and response efficiency.
* Work close with our Security Architecture team. Create and maintain technical documentation, including design documents, configuration guides, and operational procedures to ensure consistency and knowledge transfer within the team.
* Collaborate with cybersecurity engineers, and other stakeholders to implement and optimize security solutions, aligning technical capabilities with business requirements.


**Critical requirements:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or related field. Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or equivalent are preferred.
* Proven experience in designing, configuring, and maintaining security tools and technologies for detection and response purposes.
* Strong technical expertise in cybersecurity, network security, endpoint security, and threat intelligence.
* Hands-on experience with security tools such as SIEM platforms, IDS/IPS solutions, EDR tools, SOAR, XDR, VM Tools, Cloud platform and threat intelligence feeds.
* Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Facilitation of deciding on different platforms and tools in the domain.
* Detail-oriented with a focus on documenting technical designs, configurations, and procedures for knowledge sharing and continuity.


**Nice to have requirements:**
* IBM QRADAR, Tanium, Recorded Future, Virus total, Qualys, Defender in Cloud, Sentinel, AI based solutions


**Location:** 
 This is a full-time position, based in Cracow (Poland) or at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden). Regardless of the chosen location, you will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
**Find out more on:** 
 ElectroluxGroup: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: Sales Executive
description:
We are now seeking a talented Sales Executive to join Tietoevry's Financial Crime Prevention business. Are you the one to join their ambitious team and drive growth of their Financial Crime Prevention offerings in the European markets?
 



 If so, we can promise you a flexible position with a high pace that gives you the opportunity to build new business and develop clients and prospects.
 



 The role is located in Stockholm or Oslo and will require international travel. The Sales Executive will report directly to Head of Sales.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Building and managing a sales pipeline focused on generating new sales leads and opportunities in the European markets, with focus to grow Tietoevry´s footprint outside Nordics.
* Own and drive cases throughout the entire sales process, from initial contact to signing.
* Work closely with marketing and product teams to drive lead-generating activities.
* Assess new sales partnership opportunities, attract new relevant partners, and run pipeline growth with selected partners to support their international sales growth.
* Actively contribute to develop and refine Tietoevry´s go-to-market strategy.



  





**Background and experience** 



* University degree or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience that enables you to navigate through banking- and IT businesses.
* Documented experience in selling financial software or SaaS and/or complex solutions internationally. Experience within Fraud, AML, Identity, or payment technology domains is a merit.
* A genuine interest in financial crime prevention and want to position yourself as a trusted advisor in your business relationship.
* Strong negotiating skills with experience handling complex contracts.
* Fluency in English. Scandinavian language is a merit.



  





 As a person you are a natural self-starter with a passion for sales and business development. Proactive and driven, you thrive in high-paced environments, take ownership of your work, and enjoy building strong relationships. With a positive attitude and attention to detail, you’re confident in navigating long-term, complex sales cycles and engaging with stakeholders at all levels.
 



  





 If this sounds like your kind of challenge, apply today by submitting your CV and cover letter!
 



 In this recruitment process Tietoevry is collaborating with Novare Executive Search.
 



 For more information about the position or the process, please contact Johanna Svensson, johanna.svensson@novare.se. Please note that we do not accept applications through e-mail.
 



  





***About Tietoevry***




*Tietoevry is a leading global technology company with Nordic roots, employing 24,000 experts. Specializing in cloud, data, and software solutions, they serve enterprise and public-sector clients in over 90 countries. With an annual turnover of EUR 3 billion, Tietoevry is listed on NASDAQ in Helsinki, Stockholm, and Oslo Børs.* 




  





*Guided by openness, trust, and diversity, Tietoevry partners with clients to build digital futures where businesses, societies, and people thrive.* 




  





*Tietoevry Banking, the top financial software provider in the Nordics, offers modular solutions for core banking, payments, credit, and financial crime. They drive digital transformation and efficiency for financial institutions, while also combating financial crime.*

title: GRC Specialist (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Security Department oversees security, governance, risk management, and compliance, and security operations for all Agoda. We are vigilant in ensuring there is no breach or vulnerability threatening our company or endangering our employees to keep Agoda safe and protected. Given that the security ecosystem is moving forward at tremendous speed, we like to be early adaptors of recent technology and products. This would be a great challenge for those who want to work with the best technology in a dynamic and advanced environment.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 We are seeking a dedicated professional with experience in GRC (Governance, Risk Management, and Compliance). The ideal candidate will collaborate with internal stakeholders to manage Information Security and compliance risks.
 **We prioritize strong communication skills and the ability to multitask effectively** 
 . In this role, you will be expected to work on various tasks like Crisis Management, Risk Management and other GRC functions.
   

  

 The role will require and independent pro-active thinker, strong stakeholder management, and natural team player.
   

  

**This position is open to both local and international candidates with relocation support available for eligible candidates to help ensure a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.**
**In this Role, you will get to:**
* Clear concepts of Risk Management, GRC functions and industry level frameworks & standards like NIST CSF etc
* Ability to consistently assess risks and regular awareness to ensure IT policy, procedures, guidelines, and standards are implemented in the day-to-day operations.
* Delivers high quality work in a dynamic environment with minimal supervision
* Work with internal teams for maturity of security controls
* Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate and communicate during incidents and events, while working to enhance crisis management processes and procedures
* Track and ensure adequate and timeley resolution to all audit and risk assessment findings or issues relating to information security, and never miss a deadline
* Proactively and effectively communicates any gaps or improvements, both internally and externally, through written and verbal communication


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as Business, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or equivalent professional experience
* 2-4 years of experience working in a technology role, preferably in a security background.
* Strong understanding of international Information Security standards
* The ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and balance conflicting demands
* Comfortable analyzing operational and technical data, working under pressure and meeting deadlines
* Independent self-starter, problem-solving mindset, team player and ability to multi-task
* Strong communication, including presentation skills, able to convey complex concepts to a variety of audiences
* Strong project management skills
* The flexibility to make quick decisions as disasters change and develop


**It’s great if you have:** 
  

  

- Experience leading global projects across different locations

- Individuals must have IT-related experience demonstrating each of the four competencies listed below:

* Attention to Detail – Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail
* Stakeholder management – Works with clients and leadership
* Oral Communication – Expresses information to individuals or groups effectively
* Problem Solving – Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information
* Relocation package is provided in case you prefer to relocate to Bangkok, Thailand. Our benefits are…
* Hybrid Working Model

* 30 Days of Remote Working from anywhere globally every year
* Employee discount for accommodation globally
* Global team of 90+ nationalities
* 40+ offices and 25+ countries

* Benevity Subscription for employee donations
* Volunteering opportunities globally
* Free Headspace subscription
* Free Odilo & Udemy subscriptions
* Access to Employee Assistance Program (third party for personal and workplace support)
* Enhanced Parental Leave
* Life, TPD & Accident Insurance

title: Pre-Sales Manager-Financial Services
description:
**Pre-Sales Manager-Financial Services- Hybrid**
 At SAS, where you start doesn’t have to be where you end ; and there is ample opportunity for internal career mobility. Whether you’re looking to grow a new skill or experience a new role, there’s no time like the present to take the next step and we’re here to support you in your journey.
   

  

**About The Job**
 The Customer Advisory team is looking for a pre-sales manager to directly manage a team within Northern European Financial Services. The role will assist in the creation and implementation of sales initiatives, optimal staffing for sales support execution and the establishment of best practices that drive SAS revenue.
   

  

**As a Presales Manager, You Will**
* Hire, develop and retain pre-sales professionals with the necessary skills to drive our business forward.
* Directly manages day to day activities of pre-sales staff and sales support activities.
* Determines utilization of staff and resources to achieve sales goals.
* Assigns areas of responsibility across team, including sales assignments or product specialty.
* Responsible for consistent team-wide delivery of SAS technology and solution- messages to customers in sales engagements.
* Assist and identify key accounts, emerging technologies and initiative areas to determine strategies that maximize revenue.
* Works with sales management to fully qualify and manage the delivery of pre-sales Proof of Concept/Value engagements.
* Provide a Financial services business vision with sales for the regions and customers which is forward looking and innovative
* Have good awareness of both Industry trends and the application of SAS technology, its connected eco-system and market trends and forces effecting SAS


**Additional Responsibilities**
* Have the ability to deal with escalations across the region.
* Communicate with peers, senior Business stakeholder up to and including CRO, CDIO, CFO (Fraud) in large customers.
* Challenge the status quo in a constructive manner to modernise customers.
* Recommend changes in strategy where and when appropriate.
* Be able to travel both locally and NE regionally where necessary


**Role Competencies**
* Works on issues of diverse scope where analysis of situation or data requires evaluation of a variety of factors, including an understanding of current business trends. Follows processes and operational policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Acts as advisor to subordinates to meet schedules and/or resolve problems. Develops and administers schedules, performance requirements.
* Frequently interacts with subordinate supervisors, customers, and/or functional peer group managers, normally involving matters between organizational areas, other company divisions or units, or customers and their company. Often must lead a cooperative effort among members of an expanded team.
* Receives assignments in the form of objectives and determines how to use resources to meet schedules and goals. Provides guidance to subordinates within the latitude of established company policies. Recommends changes to policies and establishes procedures that affect immediate organization(s).
* You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.


**Required Qualifications**
* Typically requires eight years of experience in technical sales, marketing, or support. Experience selling, supporting, or using applications with SAS or similar technologies.
* Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business, Computer Science, or quantitative field.
* Ability to work with and lead a team.
* Demonstrated understanding of hardware and software sales techniques and principles;
* Demonstrated knowledge of at least one industry or market segment;
* Knowledge of corporate/government software and hardware acquisition cycles and buying influences preferred. .
* An equivalent combination of related education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications.


**Benefits Highlights**
* Our Recreation and Fitness center offers recorded fitness classes to help you fit movement into your day.
* Your well-being matters, and that’s why we support all dimensions of your well-being by offering programs that reduce stress and distractions to help you remain healthy and productive.


**Diverse and Inclusive**
 At SAS, it’s not about fitting into our culture – it’s about adding to it. We believe our people make the difference. Our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. Our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it’s essential to who we are. To put it plainly: you are welcome here.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com . SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.
   

  

 SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

 #SAS

title: Marketplace Manager
description:
**We are looking for our new Marketplace Manager, we believe you have the ability to see the big picture and play the short & long game at the same time. You are passionate about numbers and have the ability to get people on board!**
**Titel:** 
 Marketplace Manager
   

  

**Reports to** 
 : Chief Sales Officer
   

  

**Working hours** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Areas Of Responsibility**
**Objectives** 
**:**
 In this role you will be responsible to lead the planning onboarding and operation of our marketplace and platform sales.
   

  

 In close collaboration with wholesale & eCom increase our digital presence and drive a strong digital sales growth in our online sales channels.
   

  

 Drive a profitable and sustainable marketshare growth whilst respecting the image of the J.Lindeberg brand.
   

  

**Working Tasks**
 Responsible for the creation and implementation of our marketplace strategy.
   

  

 Oversee the brands presence and performance of the products across all online marketplaces and platforms.
   

  

 Ensure the company stays up to speed with industry trends and competitor activities.
   

  

 Be the point of contact for the marketplace, platforms and middleware providers.
   

  

 Facility business reviews with internal and external key stakeholders.
   

  

 Identify new marketplaces opportunities and platforms for expansion,
   

  

 Set strategic goals for the marketplaces and implement the tactics to reach the targets.
   

  

 Develop and manage marketplace budgets and set´s KPI´s
   

  

 Forecast and track sales trends and profits for the channel
   

  

 Monitor and analyze marketplace scorecards to identify trends and sales opportunities.
   

  

 Provide regular reports on marketplace performance within the organization.
   

  

 Collaborate with marketing and eCom teams to ensure the tools needed for the channel.
   

  

 Manage the performance marketing linked to the marketplace & platforms.
   

  

 Coordinate with Buying, Sales and Inventory Teams to optimize the assortment and ensure fulfillment and availability.
   

  

**Stakeholders**
**Internal:** 
 Wholesale, eCom, IT, Logistics & Finance
 **External:** 
 Marketplaces & external providers.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Professional Background:** 
 We believe you have been working with marketplace and platform sales as a retailer and / or for a brand in a European or Global perspective.
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Ideally experience in the apparel & footwear industry with focus on sports & lifestyle.
   

  

**Functional:** 
 +3 years in digital sales within Marketplace and Platform sales.
   

  

**Who you are:** 
 You are a true team player that likes to get things done. You don´t mind to make own decisions and prioritize your daily work. You have the ability to get people onboard and have strong negotiation and communication skills both verbally and inwritten. You have the ability to see the big picture and play the short & long game at the same time. You like numbers and to analyse your business is something you cannot get enough of.
   

  

 As part of a J.Lindeberg Team we are all from time to time involved in cross functional and collaborative projects of different character.
   

  

**J.Lindeberg Values**
 As part of J.Lindeberg you are an ambassador for J.Lindeberg and inspire our partners by living our Values
   

  

**Progressive** 
**-** 
 We strive to be at the forefront and we dare to challenge the status guo. It comes from our Scandinatian heritage – we are innovators within apparel, use of resources and way of working.
   

  

**Energetic** 
**-** 
 We are bringing energy into everything we do, we are entrepreneurial and agile. We are ready to do more and better each time. It makes our brand vibrant and magnetic.
   

  

**Inclusive -** 
 We are a people company. We are diverse and responsible. We act with integrity and take full accountability for what we do. We are a global community. We We care for the planet and each other.
   

  

 We look forward to your application soonest possible but no later than August 11th, 2024
   

  

 Founded in Stockholm 1996, J.Lindeberg inspires unconventional thinkers to live life to the fullest. The international fashion house bridges fashion and sport, offering sophisticated, edgy and comfortable products for a modern active lifestyle. The collections bring together creativity and Scandinavian progressiveness – for innovative fashion and outdoor lifestyle wear that is sustainable and delivered through a customer-focused, seamless experience.
   

  

 With headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, the distribution covers more than 35 countries. There are 157 J.Lindeberg stores in several of the major fashion capitals of the world, such as Copenhagen, New York, Tokyo, Hong Kong and Shanghai. The wholesale distribution features close to 2000 stores, including the leading high-end department and specialty stores around the world.

title: Legal Counsel
description:
*Are you experienced in working with IT and commercial contracts, tenders, tech law, and IP rights? And are you seeking challenges where you can make an immediate impact and make a difference?*
*If so, look no further – we have an exciting opportunity that might just be tailor-made for you!*
**About Group Legal & Compliance**
 In Group Legal & Compliance, we are responsible for providing legal advice to the business across a wide range of areas, including drafting and negotiating IT contracts with customers, participating in procurement processes, negotiating and entering into agreements with subcontractors, data protection, IP rights, and M&A processes – all with the aim to find the best possible solutions for EG.
   

  

 Currently, the department consists of 14 full-time legal counsels located in Denmark (Aarhus and Ballerup) and India (Mangalore) with significant experience in IT law, procurement law, data protection law, M&A, company law and corporate governance. This gives you many opportunities for professional and qualified collaboration and learning, and we truly value teamwork, a positive atmosphere, and humor.
   

  

**Your role and tasks**
 As legal counsel in EG, you will handle matters within a wide range of legal areas and collaborate with various stakeholders to solve problems and ensure compliance. Your tasks will primarily be within:
   

  

* Drafting and negotiating IT contracts with customers and vendors including data processing agreements.
* Reviewing, revising and negotiating public and private tenders.
* Drafting and revising various contract templates and ensure compliance with EG's contract management policy.
* Assisting in various M&A tasks, including integration of acquired companies into EG.
* General legal advice to the business on day-to-day legal matters.


**Commercially minded, independent, and outgoing**
 We are looking for a commercially minded lawyer with an interest in and experience with technology law and related legal areas. You should be eager and willing to engage in close dialogue with the business, challenge commercial terms and assessments, and be a business partner for the business on contractual, commercial and legal matters. Further, you possess the ability to work independently as well as part of a team, particularly in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. A proactive mindset focused on continuous improvement is highly valued.
   

  

 EG is currently undergoing significant development, which gives you a unique opportunity to shape your role and tasks. In addition to handling specific assignments, you will be involved in shaping internal processes in Group Legal & Compliance.
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you if you hold a Master of Laws or a Master of Business Law with a minimum of 3 years of experience working with IT/software law. You should demonstrate commercial understanding and be able to see connections across the business.
   

  

 As a person, you are engaged, service-minded, and self-driven. You excel at completing tasks, yet you remain persistent when necessary. Last but not least, you communicate professionally at all levels of the business in both Swedish and English, in both written and spoken forms.
   

  

**What can you expect from us?**
 An exciting and challenging daily work environment, engaging with a variety of people in different roles and across different countries.
   

  

* A professional environment with an open and informal tone.
* Talented and committed colleagues with a high level of expertise, who take responsibility, show care, and support each other.
* A team that places great importance on making work enjoyable.
* Excellent opportunities to develop your professional and personal skills.
* Targeted training courses in our EG Academy.
* A strong emphasis on health and well-being.
* A pension and insurance package.


**How To Contact Us**
 If you are interested in learning more, feel free to contact General Counsel, Sune Albert, on salbe@eg.dk. We review applications on an ongoing basis and will hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please submit your application as soon as possible. All inquiries will be treated confidentially.
   

  

 We craft the vertical software of tomorrow, bringing sustainable impact to customers and society. We always strive to improve: We are a dedicated team of innovators and problem solvers. As an integral part of our culture, we take responsibility for our contribution to customers, each other, and the society we live in.
   

  

 Read more: About EG or watch this short video: We are EG - YouTube if you want to know how the software we deliver makes a difference for many users every day. You can also watch our latest video here, where four of our dedicated colleagues share their experience of working in EG.

title: Senior Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our** 
**Team:**
 The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get** 
**to:**
* Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
* Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
* Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers


**What you’ll Need to** 
**Succeed:**
* Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
* Ability to communicate fluently in English
* Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
* Good numerical reasoning skills
* Proficiency in Excel
* Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills


**It’s Great if you** 
**Have:**
* Experience in digital marketing
* Academic research experience

title: ANAPLAN BUILDER
description:
**Main duties**
* Understanding business processes and business requirements
* Translate requirements into functional requirements and use cases, articulating solutions to the stakeholders as this role involves discussion at various levels with business stakeholders
* Design and build Anaplan application models to support business processes
* Build and develop Anaplan modules and list based on model blueprint
* Configure and maintain Anaplan lists, modules, dashboards, actions, and other model settings to meet business needs
* Transform and implement multi-dimensional structures to support business processes
* Implement high quality code using best practices
* Monitor data flows to and from the system to ensure all data is up-to-date and accurate
* Provide hands-on support/training to end users on Anaplan models and processes
* Define and administer user roles and permissions in Anaplan


**Your profile**
* Collaborative problem-solver who values connections between facts, figures, strategies, and people
* Ability to collaborate closely with all business controllers, the wider Finance community, Digital/IT, and over time further business process owners across SAS as the Anaplan tool is rolled out to other departments
* Ability to dive into the details to convert business requirements to actionable items
* Possess business acumen, strong analytical, troubleshooting, problem-solving, and project management skills
* Organized and detail-oriented
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to explain and translate between technical and non-technical people
* Proven ability to work in a demanding, fast-paced environment and manage a high workload


**Your Knowledge And Qualifications**
* Strong expertise and deep understanding of multi-dimensional modeling
* Excel spreadsheet modeling, macros, pivot tables, formulas, charts, etc.
* Subject matter expertise in Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
* Strong understanding of accounting fundamentals. P&L, BS, CF
* Experienced finance systems professional with hands-on experience with Anaplan both functionally and technically
* Ideal background in consulting and implementing full end-to-end projects in the past
* Minimum of 2 years experience as Anaplan Builder at either a larger complex corporation and/or consultancy firm specializing in Anaplan services
* In-depth knowledge of the airline industry is a huge plus but not a requirement
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a relevant field, e.g. Business Administration, Accounting, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, etc required
* Fluent in English, Swedish is a plus

title: Product Owner Finance, Solna
description:
Are you passionate about continuous improvement and have experience with SAP systems and a finance background? We’re looking for someone like you! Explore this exciting opportunity now.
   

  

 PostNord Group IT is looking for a
 **Product Owner** 
 for our Finance product team where our focus area is finance and order-to-cash development. A lot of exciting things are happening in our area due to an ongoing transformation journey where we recently have upgraded to SAP S/4 HANA.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Product Owner in Solution Area Finance, belonging to Group IT you will in collaboration with your team, be responsible to create the product roadmap and have a very good understanding of the business needs within Finance. To succeed you need to build strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure that the team’s effort is aligned with overall strategy. This role demands a proactive and knowledgeable individual who will drive the solution topics within your finance product team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Take end-to-end ownership of the product with ultimate accountability for business and customer value delivered
* Work closely with stakeholders within the PostNord Group, but mainly within Finance
* Lead an agile team with software engineers, developers and solution architects to execute and deliver value
* Define and manage product backlog priorities, and strategically de-scope to achieve rapid feedback cycle
* Prioritize product backlog items and coordinate with other teams to deliver high-quality solutions


**We Are Looking For You**
 We are looking for a curios driver who can gather, analyze and understand customer and business needs and understand impact against product backlog and impact on team.
   

  

**You Have Skills Such As-**
* Good understanding of Finance processes especially Record-to-Report, Order -to cash and Purchase to Pay.
* SAP Finance and/or other modules in SAP such as SD and BRIM.
* Previous experience of working as Product Owner/Product Manager.
* 3-5 years as a Product Owner or in a leadership role managing SAP solutions.
* Good stakeholder management and clear communication skills.
* Strong in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow up together with a “can-do attitude”
* Able to work at all levels of the organization as well as part of virtual teams.
* English and at least one Nordic language in speech and writing


**We offer you**
* Flexible hybrid workplace with an open working climate.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Welcome with your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position please send an email to petra.wahlund@postnord.com. Note that we do not accept applications via email. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com.
   

  

 For union contacts, click here

title: Marketing Manager - On-Trade
description:
**ABOUT US** 




  





 The Absolut Group (TAG) holds global responsibility for the production, packaging development, innovation and strategic marketing of an extensive range of premium spirits brands. They include the iconic Absolut Vodka, Beefeater, the world’s most awarded gin, Malibu, the leading flavoured rum and Kahlua, the number one coffee liqueur, along with a selection of agave spirits, including Altos tequila and craft gins such as Monkey 47. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, The Absolut Group is part of Pernod Ricard, a worldwide leader in the spirits and wine industry.
 



  





 We strive to redefine the global spirit market and the world we live in by inspiring people of all backgrounds to come together to mix ideas and drinks, respectfully and responsibly. And we have a true long-term commitment to sustainability – doing the right thing for consumers, society, the environment and our people.
 



  





 We are always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our team and help us shake things up. We believe that work should be more than a paycheck, so whether you are just starting your career or looking to take it to the next level, we offer a dynamic and supportive work environment that will help you grow. Come join us and let’s raise a glass to a fulfilling career and a bright future at The Absolut Group!
 



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




  





**The Advocacy team** 
 has responsibility for multiple brands in The Absolut Group portfolio (Absolut, Malibu & Kahlua), to (1) champion the On-trade & Experiences through key strategies, partnerships, visibility priorities & activation programs that enhances consumers engagement with our brands; and (2) drive Advocacy & Education by developing ‘best in class’ educational programs, experiences, and tools, to fuel and recruit passionate brand Advocates across the globe.
 



  





 As an On-Trade expert, you will sharpen our understanding of both Customers, Bartenders and Consumers in their on-trade journey, to evolve our capabilities, developing consumer-centric trade strategies that support customers business objectives and ensuring premiumisation of our brands. To generate profitable sales you will accelerate recruitment, penetration, and build consumer & bartender loyalty with programs, messaging, and activations that and are exciting and based on our key consumption moments. These programs are essential to prominently positioning our brands with consumers, but should also encourage accounts to bring them to life and elevate their perception of our brands.
 



  





 You will also be a drinks expert, leading our inhouse Drinks squad to develop and evolve Drinks Strategies, requiring you to be on top of consumer & drinks culture and have comprehensive experience with the hospitality industry. The drinks expertise extends to supporting cross functional teams across disciplines; to support advising and developing solutions for key occasions, programs and product innovation. Unique serves, drinking rituals and hero vessels will be deliverables that drive interest from the trade and also motivate consumers to trial products/serves both in the on-trade and at home.
 



  





**In this role you will responsible for:** 



* Champion On-trade capabilities for Absolut, Malibu & Kahlua by evolving RPVA strategies (Relationship, Presence, Visibility, Activation)
* Win on-trade share by creating brand building visibility assets and activation programs in collaboration with markets, that drive impact and menu prioritization
* Understand the global on-trade arena by systematically collecting & reporting information on channel trends and data, as well as the competition, to identify new opportunities
* Close collaboration with Experiences to create holistic and scalable activations for various types of accounts
* Support Shopper team to execute strong TTL (Through-The-Line) programs
* Be the internal drinks expert, leading the cross functional TAG Drinks Squad and sharing valuable input to key projects both internally and expert drinks/on-trade/industry teams in market cos and at HQ
* Collaborate to develop/evolve drinks strategies, ensuring data-driven & brand relevant drinks optimization, including drinks recipes that democratize cocktail making at home, and are sustaining for trade needs
* Support NPDs, Key occasions and Communication programs with drinks recommendations, unique serves & drinking rituals
* Support Trade Education Manager to develop relevant and memorable education programs for the hospitality industry that will drive equity and ultimately bartender recommendation.



  





**ABOUT YOU** 




  





 We see you as a highly motivated self-starter with good leadership, analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to collaborate effectively across functions with passion and enthusiasm. Strong entrepreneurial ability to work around obstacles, results driven, and a bias for action with a pilot/learn/scale approach.
 


* 10+ years in a strategic role such as brand management or product management; demonstrating well rounded business acumen and analytical experience touching many parts of the business and bringing multiple data points together to make strategic recommendations. Can set and measure KPIs.
* 5+ years of Beverage Alcohol Industry experience; Ability to understand Category growth drivers, Customer perspectives & their primary drivers, KPIs
* 5+ years On Trade experience (from brand ambassador, On trade sales, on trade trade/customer marketing, hostess, server, bartender, bar manager, beverage director, owner – any of these, preferably front of house)
* Project Management experience: Has managed multiple cross functional projects at any given time, of varying scale from start to finish.
* International or multi-country experience is preferred
* Fluent in English, championing both written and verbal communication



  





  





**OUR OFFER** 




*At The Absolut Group, we are the thinking and doing of all our brilliant people. Be audacious and to go after your dreams right from the start – and you will thrive in a passionate and progressive environment where we collaborate across borders. Be committed to a sustainable supply chain, a safe, inclusive workplace, and a responsible consumer culture, and we can achieve real change together.* 




*With our spirit of belonging, we create a culture of what we call convivialité. It’s the magic of human connections that makes things happen. You are welcome to The Absolut Group for who you are. We believe that an inclusive workplace with diversity of experiences and perspectives creates a vibrant work environment and mirrors our global consumers.* 









  





**APPLICATION** 




  





 If this role resonates with you, don’t hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





 For more information about the position or the process please contact Sara Vigliotti, Head of Talent Acquisition & Talent Management (sara.vigliotti@pernod-ricard.com). We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible.

title: (Senior) Project Manager in Consulting for Procurement / Supply Chain Management (f/m/d)
description:
We are one of the best consultancies for strategic procurement and supply chain management. As an independent subsidiary of BCG, we offer the best of both worlds: in-depth expertise and high strategic competence and we are able to draw on a strong, international infrastructure, which makes us even more dynamic in the market.
   

  

 That’s why we want to strengthen our team. With someone that matches our ambitions as well as our spirit. So that we remain not only very successful, but also very INVERTO.
   

  

 VERY EXCITING FOR YOU.
   

  

**Holistic project management.**
 You will be responsible for the development and successful implementation of suitable strategies to optimize the supply chain and strategic procurement process. You will demonstrate your entrepreneurial talent in project controlling and in the acquisition of new customers.
   

  

**Broad range of challenges.**
 Broad customer portfolios and project assignments at home and abroad for a wide variety of industries and customers. From start-ups, retail, and consumer goods, to the energy and automotive industries or the pharmaceutical and healthcare sectors.
   

  

**Intensive customer consulting.**
 You will work closely with customers, be their main contact person and be responsible for conducting your team's workshops, negotiations and presentations.
   

  

**Specific development.**
 Your professional expertise will help to drive forward the development of knowledge in our company.
   

  

**Far-reaching responsibility.**
 You will ensure that your team develops both professionally and personally. As a member of the INVERTO management team, you can help shape the development of our entire company and give it the necessary impetus.
   

  

 VERY IMPORTANT FOR US.
   

  

**University degree with above-average grades** 
 and 4-8 years of relevant professional experience.
   

  

**Extensive expertise in consulting,** 
 ideally in procurement / supply chain management and a passion for strategic and operational work.
   

  

**You have already proven your analytical and conceptual skills** 
 at management level in demanding projects. You show full commitment, are customer-oriented and cooperative. You have shown that you can successfully lead teams professionally and personally.
   

  

**Very INVERTO:** 
 Team player. Both feet firmly on the ground. Fair. Fun.
   

  

 Confident appearance in an international environment,
 **business fluent in English and any other Nordic language** 
 , flexible in your professional mobility.
   

  

 VERY BENEFIT.
   

  

 Regular team evenings, a multi-day annual conference, employee and sport events.
   

  

 Professional career development.
   

  

 Support of your academic further training.
   

  

 If needed: a longer timeout.
   

  

 Comprehensive insurance package.
   

  

 Employee referral programs.
   

  

 Child- & eldercare, coaching.
   

  

 APPLY NOW!

title: CFO till expansiva PharmaRelations, Stockholm
description:
Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär som CFO och vara en nyckelspelare i ett av Nordens största konsultbolag inom Life Science? Vi söker nu en strategisk och operativ CFO till PharmaRelations AB, ett företag i stark tillväxt som driver framgångsrika affärer i hela Norden. Är du redo att bidra med din erfarenhet och vara med på vår fortsatta tillväxtresa?
   

  

 Som CFO på PharmaRelations kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i vår framtida tillväxtresa och vara en drivande kraft bakom vår nordiska expansion. Du får det övergripande ansvaret för alla finansiella och administrativa frågor i vår verksamhet som spänner över hela Norden. Framgent kommer vi att ta steget att ta över redovisning och lön från de övriga tre nordiska länderna, då den idag är outsourcad i respektive land. Detta ger dig en fantastisk möjlighet att forma och leda denna process.
   

  

 Din erfarenhet av att hantera finansiella verksamheter över hela Norden kommer att vara avgörande när vi siktar på att expandera ytterligare. Din praktiska erfarenhet av M&A-aktiviteter och integration av förvärvade bolag kommer att vara värdefull när vi genomför strategiska förvärv som en del av vår tillväxtstrategi.
   

  

 Du kommer ha ett omfattande ansvar över ekonomi, men även HR och IT. Som en integrerad del av koncernledningen kommer du vara delaktig i att forma processen och vara ansvarig för att ta fram den finansiella informationen i affärsplanen. Ditt ansvar inkluderar att säkerställa att vår finansiella rapportering till koncernstyrelsen är både korrekt och insiktsfull, samt att du förbereder och deltar i styrelsemöten. Tillsammans med vd och övriga koncernledningen samt med styrelsen kommer du att arbeta med att ta fram strategiska underlag som direkt påverkar vår framgång och tillväxt.
   

  

 PharmaRelations sitter i fina, luftiga lokaler i Frösundavik.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Och Ansvarsområden Som CFO**
* Strategiskt och affärsmässigt ansvar i tätt samarbete med VD och ledning
* Övergripande ansvar för samtliga finansiella och administrativa frågor i hela Norden.
* Leda och genomföra förvärv (M&A) och säkerställa en smidig integration av förvärvade bolag som en del av vår tillväxtstrategi.
* Utforma och leda den strategiska budget- och planeringsprocessen tillsammans med VD.
* Ansvara för finansiell rapportering till styrelsen och aktivt delta i styrelsemöten.
* Leda implementeringen av intern redovisning för Danmark, Norge och Finland (för närvarande outsourcad).


**Kvalifikationer Och Erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren CFO och har erfarenhet från tjänsteföretag, gärna från konsultbranschen. Du har erfarenhet av nordisk verksamhet och en gedigen praktisk erfarenhet av M&A, inklusive integration av förvärvade bolag. Din stora kunskap i redovisning, controlling och bankfinansiering är avgörande för rollen. Du är en erfaren ledare och har troligtvis tidigare haft breda ansvarsområden som inkluderar löner, HR och IT. Ditt digitala kunnande kompletterar din kompetens ytterligare. En civilekonomutbildning är ett krav, och du både skriver och talar svenska och engelska flytande.
   

  

**Personliga Egenskaper**
 Vi söker en affärsinriktad person med ett starkt kommersiellt tänkande, som trivs i en dynamisk miljö där ständig utveckling och förändring är en självklar del av vardagen. Du har en stark drivkraft och handlingskraft, med förmågan att ta initiativ och leda förändringsprocesser effektivt på ett systematiskt och strukturerat sätt. Du har en stark analytisk förmåga och du uppskattar att arbeta nära VD och koncernledningen samt med styrelse och ägare.
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, Solna
   

  

**Om PharmaRelations**
 ”PharmaRelations är ett nordiskt konsultföretag som specialiserar sig på Life Science och erbjuder konsulttjänster, rekrytering, outsourcing och interimslösningar. Som en fullservice-partner kan PharmaRelations stötta företag genom alla faser av produktens livscykel, genom skräddarsydda lösningar för kundens behov av kompetens och resurser. Med fem kontor i Norden och 250 anställda har PharmaRelations gedigen erfarenhet och kompetens som täcker allt från preklinisk utveckling till post-marknadsfaser.”
   

  

**Mer Information Finns På**
**Vad erbjuder PharmaRelations dig?** 
 En spännande utvecklingsresa i ett dynamiskt nordiskt konsultföretag inom Life Science som dessutom är ett ”Great Place to Work” med fantastiska kollegor.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 I denna rekryteringsprocess samarbetar PharmaRelations med Meritmind. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter på Meritmind,
 **Ulrika Wallerman 070-166 08 60** 
 eller
 **Marie Edström Barter på 070-509 94 14.** 
 Intervjuer och urval kommer att ske löpande, så skicka gärna din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Se till att namn och kontaktuppgifter finns med i ditt CV. Det räcker att du bifogar ditt CV. Denna tjänst kan du söka så länge annonsen finns tillgänglig på vår hemsida.
   

  

 Meritmind arbetar kompetensbaserat för att främja en objektiv och icke-diskriminerande rekryteringsprocess. Detta innebär bland annat att du kommer att få göra arbetspsykologiska tester om du går vidare till intervju i denna process och att du inte behöver skicka in ett personligt brev. Vid de flesta tillsättningar görs också en bakgrundskontroll.
   

  

**Tänk på detta innan du skickar in din ansökan (i enlighet med GDPR-lagstiftningen)**
* Din ansökan ska ej innehålla personuppgifter kring civilstatus, familjesituation/barn, etniskt ursprung, ålder, politiska åsikter, religiös eller filosofisk övertygelse, medlemskap i fackförening, hälsa eller sexuell läggning.


**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Godkänn datalagring**
 För att kunna registrera din ansökan behöver vi ett godkännande att spara dina personuppgifter. Läs mer på vår
   

  

**Ansök till denna tjänst**
 Ansök med
   

  

 För att vi ska kunna genomföra en så objektiv rekryteringsprocess som möjligt ber vi dig utesluta känsliga personuppgifter så som ålder, civilstatus, familjesituation/barn, etniskt ursprung, politiska åsikter, religiös eller filosofisk övertygelse, medlemskap i fackförening, hälsa eller sexuell läggning.

title: Senior Legal Counsel
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Anyfin, we're on a mission to revolutionize financial services, empowering individuals across Sweden, Finland, Norway, and Germany to optimize their finances and save money. We've already helped millions refinance costly consumer credits, but our ambitions reach far beyond. We're gearing up for substantial growth, with plans to expand our customer base, introduce innovative products, and penetrate new markets. To achieve this, we're seeking a seasoned Senior Legal Counsel to join our Legal & Compliance team.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 Let's cut to the chase: Legal & Compliance are the keystones of our operations at Anyfin. We don't just show up at the eleventh hour for review; we're deeply embedded in the value creation process from start to finish. Trying to navigate the regulatory landscape of a multinational fintech enterprise without this approach? Trust us, it's a recipe for disaster.
   

  

 In this role, reporting directly to our General Counsel, you'll lead our legal initiatives, ensuring our activities align with legal and regulatory standards while facilitating business growth. From guiding product launches to negotiating contracts, you'll collaborate across departments, providing strategic legal advice that fuels our expansion.
   

  

 Every day will present new challenges, but your core responsibilities will include crafting and executing our legal strategy, providing actionable advice to senior stakeholders, and guiding new initiatives with a pragmatic, risk-aware mindset. And yes, we promise not to call you in at the eleventh hour - most of the time, this is a scaleup after all...
   

  

**Who You Are**
 To thrive in this role, we're seeking candidates who embody the following:
   

  

* A Swedish law degree
* Between five and ten years of experience in high-paced industries like tech, fintech, or e-commerce
* Exceptional English communication skills
* Demonstrable strategic thinking paired with a pragmatic approach
* Previous experience in law firms or roles encompassing complex responsibilities
* A passion for solving legal problems and collaborating closely with colleagues to achieve shared goals


 If you're the right fit, you understand the importance of teamwork and possess the drive to deliver optimal legal solutions in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Joining Anyfin means being part of an extraordinary journey. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams, influencing the trajectory of our business. As we continue to expand, your role will evolve into a leadership position within our legal department.
   

  

 Expect to be challenged, encouraged to grow, and surrounded by brilliant minds. Our compensation package is competitive, and we offer perks like a centrally located office, birthday leave, and more.
   

  

 Ready to embark on this adventure with us? Click "Apply" below, and let's start shaping the future together. We can't wait to meet you!
   

  

 Anyfin is a Swedish fintech on a mission to improve financial well-being and revolutionize debt management. We empower consumers to track all of their credits and loans in one place and reduce the costs of high-interest credits.

title: Onsite-tekniker IT-Support
description:
TechTrade International AB stödjer privata vård och omsorgsföretag i olika IT-relaterade frågor. Vi är IT-avdelning hos en rad olika vårdverksamheter.
   

  

 Vår vision är att bidra till ett friskare samhälle genom att skapa mer tid till vården och för patientmöten.
   

  

**TechTrade International AB söker en engagerad och kunnig onsite-tekniker för IT-support. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att utvecklas och bidra till vår framgång.**
 Vi på TechTrade International AB är IT-avdelningen/IT-stöd till ca 200 privata vårdgivare runt om i Sverige. Vi brinner för att effektivisera och utveckla vården i Sverige. Vårt bidrag till samhället är att skapa mer tid för vårdgivarna och sina patienter.
   

  

 Som IT-tekniker på TechTrade får du möjlighet att vara med och bygga vår nya support ”Support 2025” där kundupplevelsen står helt i centrum och där vi ska skapa bra rutiner och arbetssätt för att lösa våra kunders ärenden. Du kommer få stöttning och coachning av vår supportchef Malin i din utveckling.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Du kommer att ingå i en grupp där vi kommer att arbeta med att ta emot och lösa ärenden i vårt ärendehanteringssystem. Det gäller att kunna sätta sig in i användarnas situation och trivas i rollen för att få kundens miljö att fungera problemfritt. I den här rollen kommer du att erbjudas stora möjligheter att utvecklas och växa inom IT.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
* Ge teknisk support och felsökning på plats hos våra kunder.
* Installera och konfigurera hårdvara och mjukvara.
* Utföra underhåll och uppgraderingar av IT-system.
* Samarbeta med andra tekniker och avdelningar för att lösa tekniska problem.
* Ha alltid kunden i centrum.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Erfarenhet 1-2 år av IT-support och teknisk felsökning
* Erfarenhet av Windows, utskriftshantering, nätverksadministration, AD och Office 365
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team
* God kommunikationsförmåga i både tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Van att arbeta självständigt och planera arbetet
* Ordning och reda är en självklarhet
* B-körkort


**Meriterande**
* Arbetat med Intune
* Relevanta IT-certifieringar
* Arbetat inom vården


**Vi erbjuder**
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö och trevliga kollegor
* Möjlighet till personlig och professionell utveckling
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner


**Övrig information**
* Plats: Kista, Stockholm
* Omfattning: 100%
* Provanställning under 6 månader, därefter tillsvidareanställning
* Start: Omgående


 Vi ser gärna att du som söker tjänsten i grunden har en data-/IT-/teknisk inriktning på gymnasiet eller annan teknisk utbildning. Vi tror att du är en person som har ett genuint intresse för support. Du är en person som tycker om att finnas till hands för kunden och som har service som prioritering i ditt arbete. Du kan på ett pedagogiskt sätt supporta och vägleda kunder via telefon och mejl.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vid ansökan så kommer vi göra en bakgrundskontroll på de sökanden.

title: IT Systems Engineer
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Föreslå och driva långsiktiga förbättringar och förändringar
* Samarbeta med viktiga stakeholders - systemägare, systemförvaltare, leverantörer och specialister
* Ansvara för utveckling, drift, support och förvaltning av våra applikationer


 Är du redo för något intressant? På SBAB jobbar vi värderingsdrivet. Wow! Hoppas vi att du tänker, men vi förstår om det inte känns som något nytt eller om ordet inte väcker det intresse som vi vill.
   

  

 Men våra värderingar är viktiga för oss på riktigt! De handlar om att jobba smart med fart, ta ansvar hela vägen, vara stolta proffs och att lyckas tillsammans. Faktum är att värderingarna hjälper oss att fatta kloka beslut – och vi vill att du gör detsamma hos oss. De hjälper dig i rätt riktning, stöttar att ta egna initiativ, ha roligt tillsammans, jobba ihop och bidra till att våra kunder får en bättre boendeekonomi. Fortfarande intresserad? Välkommen!
   

  

 Att jobba som IT systems engineer
   

  

 Tech Systems är ett nytt team på SBAB där vi nu söker en IT systems engineer med bakgrund inom systemförvaltning. Tech System ansvarar för vårt asset-register med alla system och en viktig pusselbit är att driva det arbetet framåt. Vi arbetar nära kompetenser inom applikation, infrastruktur, nätverk och support. Vi drivs av ständig förbättring och att leverera både tillgängliga och säkra system. Vår omfattande tekniska plattform har många viktiga applikationer och system som stöttar upp bankens tekniska behov. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra infra-team och vårt helpdeskteam.
   

  

 Som IT systems engineer jobbar du självdrivet efter våra värderingar. Du identifierar förbättringsmöjligheter och jobbar proaktivt. En viktig del av rollen är att föreslå och driva långsiktiga förbättringar och förändringar i linje med vår IT- strategi. Då ser vi gärna att du har ett intresse av att arbeta strategiskt och ansvarar för omvärldsanalysen inom området.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har bred generalistkompetens och vill ansvara för utveckling, drift, support och förvaltning av våra applikationer. Du har erfarenhet av applikationsdrift i Linux och/eller Windows-miljö. Vi arbetar nära våra kollegor och det är viktigt att vi stöttar verksamheten i alla dialoger om applikationer, säkerhet, uppdateringar, patchning och förbättringar. Vi ser gärna att du haft tidigare erfarenhet av leverantörsstyrning. Placeringsort för denna roll är Solna, och rollen kräver att du talar svenska.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Strategisk
* Ansvarstagande
* Initiativtagande
* Hjälpsam
* Lagspelare


 Annars då?
   

  

 Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

title: IT- och datakoordinator
description:
Är du bra på siffror och analys? Vår kund söker nu en IT- och datakoordinator som kan supporta och hantera uppgifter i deras ledningsgrupp och team. För denna roll är vi ute efter en självständig och pålitlig person med stark känsla för ansvar. För att trivas i denna roll ska du ha ett prestigelöst mindset, tycka om snabba miljöer och ha ett extra öga för struktur. Sök nu, vi applicerar löpande urval.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Kista, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 HR/kontor/administration
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, kontorstider
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vår kunds B2C IT-team är nu i behov av en dynamisk och pålitlig person som har lätt för siffror och analys av data. I rollen kommer du direkt stötta team, men främst ansvariga i ledningsgruppen, med att koordinera, följa upp och hantera olika uppgifter. Nyckelansvar i rollen innefattar insamling, förberedande och paketering av material för möten, presentationer och rapporter. Du bidrar med en betydande roll för teamen- och ledningsgruppens struktur samt ger värdefull support kring KPI:er och rapporter.
 


  


 Vi söker dig som är flexibel och redo att hugga tag i olika slags uppgifter, högt som lågt, där du enkelt kan ändra din prioritering baserat på deadline för diverse uppgifter. Du ska tycka om att samarbeta och gärna ha erfarenhet av att supporta ledningsgrupp sedan tidigare. Vi tror att du kommer bli framgångsrik i denna roll om du utöver sinne för siffror och analys, besitter en hög integritet som drivs av din självständighet och problemlösningsförmåga.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Ett givande konsultuppdrag på minst 6 månader med möjlighet till förlängning om alla parter är nöjda
  
* En fot in på ett spännande och meriterande bolag
  
* En dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar och hjälper dig under uppdragets gång
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Koordinera, följa upp och hantera uppgifter i ITB2C LT och i samarbete med support funktioner
  
* Samla in, förbereda och paketera material för möten, presentationer och rapporter.
  
* Bidra över teamen och projekt med struktur
  
* Support med KPI och rapporter
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en stark organisatorisk förmåga med ett strukturerat förhållningssätt till uppgiftshantering
  
* Besitter mycket goda kunskaper i PowerPoint och Excel för presentationer och dataanalys. Bra på att paketera information.
  
* Har förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter, prioritera effektivt och leverera under snäva deadlines.
  
* Är bra med siffror och analys
  
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande (både i tal och skrift).
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Tidigare erfarenhet som management trainee alt. executive assistant
  
* IT-erfarenhet
   

 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Agnes Lekenhed eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107481

title: Technical Engineer - Payments
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is one of the biggest fashion companies in the world. We are a family of brands, driven by our mission to make a sustainable lifestyle an option for the many. With our customers at heart, we offer fashion, design, and services to millions of customers every day.
   

  

 We believe that it’s when you mix and match different talents, experiences, and styles that the real magic happens. That’s why our teams are built with different personalities, talents and people from all kinds of backgrounds. If you are willing to learn, grow and help our customers and your colleagues, H&M will always be a place for you to both express your individuality and feel like you belong. Be yourself & more at H&M.
   

  

**Job Description**
**About the team:**
 The Store Payments Enablement team operates in the Component layer that is responsible for producing secure, composable payment solutions in a cost-efficient manner and as per completive time-to-market delivery timelines. The team is global and supports all card and alternative payments in store for all stores and brands in all our markets.
   

  

 The Component team is managed by a Product Manager. The team’s vision is to strive for fast, secure, and frictionless payments. With an agile mindset and a passion for technology, provide best in class services for our customers and stakeholders.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a technical engineer, you are responsible for designing solutions for Payment Service Providers and accountable for configuration, and development in the support of new payment technologies to be introduced at H&M. You work with a variety of different payment technologies to create innovative solutions to real world problems. As a technical engineer you think creatively and independently, and you support the engineering of designs for new payment technologies or improvements on existing ones.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Define platform architecture and design based on the needs of stakeholders, technology and new innovations
* Support commercial advisor with technical expertise in commercial negotiations, procurement and other escalations with service providers such as Payment Service Provider and providers of POS
