title: Tax Compliance Regulatory Counsel - Partner management
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a critical role in supporting and growing Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream by engaging with the Sovos partner ecosystem and supporting their needs as they look to Sovos for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements in their solution portfolios and customer implementations. This position combines the expertise of a Regulatory Counsel, requiring deep knowledge and ongoing involvement in the processes of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, with the role of a liaison officer dedicated to facilitating partners’ access to the broader regulatory function within Sovos. This role reports to the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design.


*More specifically you will:*



* The Regulatory Liaison Counsel is responsible for bridging the gap between Sovos' regulatory expertise and its strategic ISV partners, ensuring seamless integration of relevant compliance aspects of Sovos solutions in various markets.
* Partner closely with Sovos functions managing the business and technical aspects of relationships with ISV partners to ensure satisfaction of partners’ compliance needs within the scope of Sovos software solutions.
* Maintain accountability for a ‘regulatory helpdesk SLA’ that allows Sovos partners to act with confidence, ensuring timely and appropriate Sovos regulatory input towards their customers.
* Ensure a deep understanding of Sovos Regulatory Affairs and broader interaction with public authorities on an ongoing basis.
* Work continuously with Sovos Alliances, Sales Engineering, Product Management, and other relevant functions to develop and maintain a robust understanding of Sovos’ partner ecosystem and the specific business processes and associated compliance needs that arise in that context.
* Represent the requirements of Sovos ISV and embedded partners in the evolving scope and day-to-day execution of regulatory monitoring, design, and affairs in close collaboration with colleagues in the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, as well as with Regulatory Affairs, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and other Sovos colleagues involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting, and maintaining Sovos solutions.
* Act as an integral part of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, internalizing contextual and factual knowledge that allows the Regulatory Liaison Counsel to act as independently as possible in their key role towards Sovos partners while also maintaining an excellent understanding of roles, responsibilities, and time allocation for partner support within the larger Regulatory Analysis and Design Department.
* Support the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design and their teams to ensure optimization of resources in support of all relevant Sovos functions and help them with time and resource planning towards that goal.
* Explain complex tax rules in clear language for both tax and non-tax professionals, internally and externally.
* Support Partner Marketing by providing tax-centric marketing material and participating in webinars.
* In collaboration with Sovos Marketing and partner management functions, participate as a Sovos regulatory thought leader and subject matter expert in Partner events, advisory boards, and publications.
  

**What We Need From You**


* Juris Doctor (JD) degree or equivalent master’s degree in law, finance, or accounting.
* Proficiency in legislative tracking and tax research techniques.
* Experience in working within and a deep understanding of the enterprise software market, including the value-add of different categories of enterprise software to size and geographic segments in the business sector.
* Experience in working with and deep understanding of businesses’ financial, logistical, administrative, and IT processes and strategies.
* A strong affinity for and proven ability to communicate effectively with professionals in information technology, data science, and computer-assisted business processes.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent research, analysis, and writing skills.
* Ability to read, interpret, and understand tax-related postings and documents.
* Ability to generate and interpret functional and high-level technical design content as it pertains to compliance and business processes.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities.
* Additional language skills are strongly preferred.
* Minimal travel required to Sovos locations and events.

  



**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Flexible within the UK, Germany, Sweden, Netherlands, or Portugal.
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, colour, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*


**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
company_description: Sovos is a global SaaS company capable of meeting your regulatory compliance needs anywhere you do business.

title: Receptionist till smådjurklinik!
description:
Vi söker en receptionist till vår smådjursklinik.
  
Du är klinikens ansikte utåt. Du är ofta den första att hälsa besökare välkomna och den som vanligtvis svarar i telefon. Som receptionist tar du emot kunder, djur, gör tidsbokningar, kassaarbete, kontakt med försäkringsbolag, butiksförsäljning och beställningar. Du behöver ha goda datorkunskaper och ett bra siffersinne. Som person är du kommunikativ, glad, öppen och kan hantera stressiga situationer. Det är bra om du har kunskap om provet cloud-programmet samt erfarenhet av att arbeta med djur eller är utbildad djurvårdare. Provtjänstgöring med möjlighet till fast tjänst 80%.
  
**Din ansökan skickas till:** jobbhagaveterinar@gmail.com
  
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 2024-10-31

title: Business Analyst
description:
**The team, position and mission:**  

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join the Business Control & Analytics team at Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business. The team as a whole plays a crucial role in supporting the organization through strategic management of financial data and business processes. In this role you will work closely with, and learn from two colleagues based in Oslo belonging to the DWH section of this team. ***Read on to see why they think you should join the team!***

As a part of the DWH team, you’ll be essential to ensuring correct billing processes, managing both prepaid and volume invoicing twice a month. You will also be responsible for developing and maintaining reports in data warehouse as well as our customer invoicing system. Additionally, your team serves as the key point of contact for how we measure and invoice new products and services.


This position is vital to the business, as the team will ensure that data is accurately measured, transferred, and processed through the data warehouse, before being provided to the billing system. The reports generated from this data will play a crucial role in providing in-depth analysis and supporting informed decision-making.

**Areas of responsibility:**

* Delivering accurate billing data to the billing system
* Create billing logic within data warehouse
* Underlying procedures, dataflow and business logic in CLT, our customer billing system
* Process both prepaid- and volume invoices
* Diagnosing, prioritizing, and resolving invoicing errors
* Planning, assessing and executing maintenance of content in data warehouse
* Collaborating with Data Analysts and Production Control to ensure data availability to other systems, while also serving as backup for Power BI services
* Contribute to projects related to data and/or cost models
* Standardize workload

**Why you should be interested in joining the team according to the team members:**

* *“You’ll play a crucial role in the organization, transforming raw data into revenue. I find it motivating to be involved in such a vital part of the process and to truly understand the flow of data within our company.”*
* *“This role offers opportunities for career growth, especially if you are interested in a position with internal collaboration. You will engage with various teams across the organization, which will give you valuable insights and learning opportunities.”*
* *“After previously working directly with customers, I enjoyed transitioning to a role without direct customer contact where my focus shifted to internal systems. This is a perfect opportunity for someone who prefers working with internal processes and colleagues, while gaining a good understanding of the data flow within our organization.”*

**We are looking for people who have**:

  
* At least 2 years relevant experience working with SQL/data warehouse reporting
* Practical experience with ETL process
* Practical experience with BI reporting

* A curiosity for new technologies and explore innovative ways of working

**It’s an added bonus but not a requirement if you have knowledge of:**

  
* Experience from working with programming/coding

**What we offer you:**

  
* We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
* An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
* A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
* Read more about the benefits we offer here

 **About Orange Business:**  

Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.

In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.

Interested but feel that you don't match the criteria 100%? We encourage you to apply anyway! Your perfect match might be the next job we are announcing, so why not have a head start and apply now!

title: Cybersecurity Services Business Development Manager
description:
Eaton has been a key player in the Middle East for 40 years. This July, we announced the construction of a **new sustainable campus in Dubai**, which will bring together our commercial, manufacturing, and support functions, providing room for future growth.  

  

**About Eaton**  

Eaton is a power management company where we provide energy-efficient solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power more efficiently, safely and sustainably. Eaton is dedicated to improving the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technology and services. Eaton has approximately 96,000 employees and sells products to customers in more than 175 countries.

  

We are seeking an experienced **Cybersecurity Services Business Development Manager** to join our team in **Dubai**.

**What you’ll do:**
-------------------

  

As a **Cybersecurity services Business Development Manager**, you will be responsible for the generation of incremental OT cybersecurity and risk advisory consulting business by identifying new sales leads and project opportunities with Eaton Services and prospecting for new opportunities within existing client accounts and industry verticals. This role requires knowledge of IT/OT Security programs, including IT/OT Security Strategy, OT Security Operations, Security Training and Awareness, IT/OT General Controls Compliance and Audit Management and OT Risk. The Cybersecurity Services Business Development will be driving sales growth of Cybersecurity Services in Middle East as primely focus.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Define and execute the commercial and technical strategy for cybersecurity services to Eaton’s customers
* Drive business development, forecast accuracy, and achieve strategic goals by leading key customers through the entire business cycle for Cybersecurity Services
* Manage, Grow and Execute on a pipeline of new and existing accounts and opportunities for CS
* Achieve annual sales target defined for Cybersecurity services in Middle East territories.
* Develop business plans and strategies to expand service offerings within key accounts.
* Partners with multiple departments to drive measurable results that benefit service business in the Cybersecurity Services area
* Participate in the development of account plans and goals with Account Managers and other team members for CS services
* Develop and conduct presentations on key aspects of OT cybersecurity and demonstrate Eaton’s thought leadership on advanced topics
* Identify and evaluate technologies and partners that can increase Eaton’s capabilities to address customer ICS/OT cybersecurity challenges and drive revenue growth for Eaton products and services.
* Participate in the RFP/RFI process to position the company’s services against competitors.
* Identifies new service business opportunities and acts as the leader for promoting the implementation together with Country Services Sales Managers and Key Accounts team.
* Able to implement an effective sales approach that expands our reach, strengthens client relationships, and trains our sales professionals for Cybersecurity Services
* Actively seeks out other business opportunities that can boost revenue and helps the company attaining his challenging goals.
* Assume lead and/or support role in cybersecurity assigned projects (e.g. RFP responses, presentation, consulting etc.) ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of the customer.
* Support execution of a broad range of full lifecycle cybersecurity services for ICS and SCADA environments, for Eaton’s clients, including risk assessments, design, consulting, commissioning, hardening, solution deployment (e.g. industrial cybersecurity monitoring), and training and generation of associated security documentation.
* Travel to customer sites to support the above activities
* Collaborate with marketing team to develop and maintain go to market strategies around Operation Security, Data Privacy, OT Compliance, OT Risk and Data Governance
**Qualifications:**
-------------------


* Bachelor’s in Computer science, Computer [Cyber]Security, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or comparable degree.
* Strong experience in business development for the services of at least 5-7 years
* 5+ years of experience selling cybersecurity services at customer sites, preferably in ICS environments, including threat modeling, cybersecurity assessments and associated risk management, security appliance integration, vulnerability assessment, penetration testing and deployment of monitoring solutions.
* 3+ years of experience analyzing cybersecurity vulnerability risk tool results (including DoD SCAP and OVAL) or Nessus
* 3+ years of experience with ICS networking including configuration and hardening of switches, routers, and firewalls
* 5+ years of experience designing and implementing ICS and OT systems (e.g. DCS, SCADA, BAS, BMS, EPMS) and familiarity with SCADA protocols, communication, and technologies (Modbus, BACnet, DNP3, IEC-61850, Cellular communication, LAN, WAN, VPN, PLCs, VFDs, UPSs)
* 1+ years of experience hardening Windows and Linux assets
**Skills:**
-----------


* Familiar with industry relevant cybersecurity standards and best practices including UL-2900, IEC 62443, NIST 800-82, , NERC CIP, CIS CSC
* Understanding of security software solutions (IPS, Firewall, application firewalls, device security, encryption, etc.)
* Experience in cloud security
* Experience designing security solutions for distributed systems.
* Experience with Substation, Microgrid, Smart Grid, and distributed energy systems"
* Ability to influence and work with various technical leads in different organizations.
* Ability to respond quickly and effectively to changing priorities.
* Ability to interface directly with executives and other senior leaders of different business units.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills including the ability to explain technical concepts and present to business unit leaders and customers.
* Ability to foster collaboration across global development teams.
* Abreast of upcoming security development engineering tools, trends, and methodologies.
* Strong problem solving and reasoning ability, exhibiting technical innovation and creative solutions.
* Ability to lead and manage diverse areas and large, complex projects
**What we offer:**
------------------


* Being part of a company that has been in business for more than 100 years, is well known in the industry, and has a major impact on the energy industry
* Work in a company that is commitment to Inclusion & Diversity and Sustainability
* Annual mentoring program, Eaton University, a reward, and recognition system
* Ongoing Learning and Career Development Opportunities in a global company. Build your career and apply internally for our open positions worldwide
* Strong, agile and diverse team locally and globally
* Strong processes and state-of-the-art systems and tools
* Structured employee development processes, open feedback culture with development plans
* Detailed induction support and well-structured onboarding
* Balance your work and life with a hybrid worktime model


#LI-SA2

**Living and Working in Dubai:**

  

Dubai is a vibrant, cosmopolitan city known for its modern architecture, luxurious lifestyle, and rich cultural heritage. Living and working in Dubai offers an exceptional quality of life with world-class amenities, a safe environment, and a thriving expatriate community. Experience a dynamic blend of work and leisure in one of the world’s most exciting cities.

  

Ready to make a difference? Join Eaton’s Dubai Team and be part of a company shaping the future of sustainable manufacturing and power management!

  

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law.

title: Senior Product Manager - Delivery Management Services
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Join us as Senior Product Manager for Delivery Management Services where your skills in product management will be put to a test leading a senior and agile team of 20+ people delivering a high number of prioritized initiatives.
   

  

**About the Product Area:**
 Delivery Management Services enables online delivery and return offers to our customers by connecting carrier services to our warehouses and stores. The product is also responsible for the track and trace information. The product mission is to provide a single source of truth of last-mile information and logic to enable a great delivery experience for our customers. All services delivered are on a modern and cloud-based tech stack.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
 As a Senior Product Manager, you will be instrumental in leading the product team to meet customer needs and bring value to the business. Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:
   

  

**Team leadership** 
 : Mentor and coach team members, demonstrating leadership and fostering an agile culture building a multi-competent and efficient team
   

  

**Collaboration and coordination champion:** 
 Working closely with other tech teams, regions, and other stakeholders throughout the company actively participating in initiatives beyond your product scope.
   

  

**Delivery** 
 : Set roadmap and champion product vision. Ensure effective and on-time deliveries.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We believe you are an ambitious person, full of drive and optimism. We also believe you are structured and thorough with excellent communication skills as well as adept in identifying new possibilities and improving ways of working. To be successful in this role, we also see that you have:
   

  

* Seniority: 8+ years of product experience and proficiency in core Product Management principles including prioritization, team leadership, and stakeholder management.
* Leadership: You are people-skilled and have previous experience of successfully leading a system development team of at least 8-10 people in an agile setup.
* Agile way of working: You have an agile mindset and a deep understanding of agile principles that you have practiced previously
* Functional background: You have a good business acumen of E-commerce delivery experience, last-mile logistics, and an understanding of Warehouse Operations.
* English proficiency: Great communication skills in English.
* Technology: You have previous experience with cloud solutions, preferably Microsoft Azure.


**Additional Information**
 This role is based out of Stockholm, Sweden. If you feel your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply by sending your CV (no need for a cover letter) by
 **7th October 2024** 
 .
   

  

***Diversity, Inclusion, and Innovation***
*At H&M Group, we're deeply committed to fostering a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We actively seek out qualified candidates regardless of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.
   

  

 Our commitment to an inclusive workplace drives our dynamic and forward-thinking culture. Regardless of your background, origin, or preferences, your application is warmly welcomed. We value diverse perspectives and skills, and every applicant contributes to our vibrant, creative community. Join us and be part of the future we're building.*
**Our Offer**
 At H&M Group, you're not just joining a team – you're joining a value-driven culture and an expansive tech network. Enjoy perks like staff discount cards, flexible work arrangements, wellness benefits, parental support, and more. Here, you're encouraged to be yourself, experiment, and chart your own growth path. As you flourish, so do we, with opportunities to create tangible impacts and shape the future.

title: Team Manager - Online Fraud Prevention
description:
**Job Description**
 To provide a secure, trustworthy, and always available experience to our customers, we are now transforming the way we address the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have created a new Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments. Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a unit that focuses on Cyber Security Engineering, with the mission to protect our customers, colleagues, and company by establishing and managing safe and secure technology use.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to lead one of our Global Engineering teams, focused on Cyber crime and
 **Online Fraud Prevention** 
 to drive our delivery and services portfolio throughout the whole H&M Group and all our brands. You will report to the Head of Cyber Security Engineering Unit.
   

  

 We are looking for a strong
 **Manage** 
 r and principal leader within B2C Online e-commerce Fraud prevention who can drive our delivery and services portfolio.
   

  

 You will ensure that core capabilities are in place to manage Cybercrime, online Fraud and Loss prevention. You will grow and mature the internal and external organisation, from individual team members to our managed services partners. You will drive risk management work related to the Cybercrime area, improve the security posture to meet current and emerging threats, and proactively work with compliance to policies and regulations. More specifically you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Manage day-to-day activities of the Online Fraud Prevention team, ensuring operational and performance objectives are met.
* Spear-head team-level budgeting, planning, and roadmap initiatives.
* Cultivate professional development within the team to ensure relevant skills and qualifications.
* Navigate stakeholder relationships to align Fraud Prevention with business needs, regulatory requirements, and company policies.
* Contribute to the Cyber Security strategy and ensure team alignment.
* Respond to audit findings, prioritize remediation measures, and manage your team's budget, including staff, contracts, and technology.
* Identify demands, objectives, and key results, defining and monitoring supporting KPIs and metrics.
* Ensure the availability, stability, and performance of Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention services.
* Assess and manage risks to the effectiveness of platforms and services, protecting against current and emerging threats.


**Qualifications**
 We envision you as a seasoned leader with experience in a Leadership role, preferably within retail or e-commerce, deploying modern technologies in large, complex organizations. Key attributes include:
   

  

* Have a background in leading online e-commerce Fraud Prevention teams for B2C, specializing in areas such as payments fraud, chargeback rates reduction, discount abuse, gift card abuse, account takeovers, and e-commerce fraud attacks.
* Creative and critical thinking, offering ideas and solutions to ongoing challenges.
* A track record of successful Cybercrime, Online Fraud, and Loss prevention deliveries in complex global environments.
* Experience in leading a team that designs, implements, and deploys Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention solutions.
* Working hands-on experience in areas such as cybercrime, online fraud, loss prevention, cyber forensics investigations, or proactive pattern recognitions.
* End-to-end project delivery experience with hands-on involvement in product development for Cybercrime and online Fraud prevention.
* Experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Leadership understanding of team dynamics and staff personal development.
* Beneficial certifications: CISSP, CISM, CompTia Security+, Identity Management Institute (IMI) certifications.


 Above all, we value your passion, pride in achievements, and the ability to share this enthusiasm with your colleagues.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What we offer!**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want, and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm

title: Solutions Architect Enterprise, AWS Sweden
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Sweden and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
   

  

 Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.
   

  

 They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
   

  

 Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploy production workloads on AWS. Provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will have the support to grow your expertise. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments. At AWS you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
* Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
* English business level communication skills written and verbal


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**The team, position and mission:** 




 We are looking for a Business Analyst to join the Business Control & Analytics team at Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business. The team as a whole plays a crucial role in supporting the organization through strategic management of financial data and business processes. In this role you will work closely with, and learn from two colleagues based in Oslo belonging to the DWH section of this team.
 ***Read on to see why they think you should join the team!***




  





 As a part of the DWH team, you’ll be essential to ensuring correct billing processes, managing both prepaid and volume invoicing twice a month. You will also be responsible for developing and maintaining reports in data warehouse as well as our customer invoicing system. Additionally, your team serves as the key point of contact for how we measure and invoice new products and services.
 



  





 This position is vital to the business, as the team will ensure that data is accurately measured, transferred, and processed through the data warehouse, before being provided to the billing system. The reports generated from this data will play a crucial role in providing in-depth analysis and supporting informed decision-making.
 



  





**Areas of responsibility:** 



* Delivering accurate billing data to the billing system
* Create billing logic within data warehouse
* Underlying procedures, dataflow and business logic in CLT, our customer billing system
* Process both prepaid- and volume invoices
* Diagnosing, prioritizing, and resolving invoicing errors
* Planning, assessing and executing maintenance of content in data warehouse
* Collaborating with Data Analysts and Production Control to ensure data availability to other systems, while also serving as backup for Power BI services
* Contribute to projects related to data and/or cost models
* Standardize workload



  





**Why you should be interested in joining the team according to the team members:** 



* *“You’ll play a crucial role in the organization, transforming raw data into revenue. I find it motivating to be involved in such a vital part of the process and to truly understand the flow of data within our company.”*
* *“This role offers opportunities for career growth, especially if you are interested in a position with internal collaboration. You will engage with various teams across the organization, which will give you valuable insights and learning opportunities.”*
* *“After previously working directly with customers, I enjoyed transitioning to a role without direct customer contact where my focus shifted to internal systems. This is a perfect opportunity for someone who prefers working with internal processes and colleagues, while gaining a good understanding of the data flow within our organization.”*



  





**We are looking for people who have** 
 :
 


* At least 2 years relevant experience working with SQL/data warehouse reporting
* Practical experience with ETL process
* Practical experience with BI reporting
* Good understanding of both technical and business aspects of invoicing and financial processes
* Structured, organized and have an eye for details, with a knack for spotting inconsistencies and ensuring accuracy
* A curiosity for new technologies and explore innovative ways of working
* New logic/rules/process will be developed, and the ability to document is important (both user and system documentation)
* Education within IT and/or Business
* Fluent communication skills in English (verbal and written)



  





**It’s an added bonus but not a requirement if you have knowledge of:** 



* Experience from working with programming/coding
* Knowledge within IT business and cloud services



  





**What we offer you:** 



* We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
* An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
* A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
* Read more about the benefits we offer
 **here**



  





**About Orange Business:** 




 Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.
 



  





 Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.
 



  





 With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.
 



  





**The process:** 




 We screen applications on an ongoing basis, with the aim of conducting conversations and interviews as we receive them.
 



  





 Interested but feel that you don't match the criteria 100%? We encourage you to apply anyway! Your perfect match might be the next job we are announcing, so why not have a head start and apply now!

 **Website**

 account.

title: Senior Project Manager
description:

* The possibility to help create and shape a brand-new business.
* Opportunities to work on prestigious assignments with established Swedish and international companies, as well as start-ups.
* The chance to work with senior professionals from the IT consulting world as well as data consultants, management consultants and all aspects of the Newground Alliance.

* A home in amazing offices located at Norrmalmstorg, Stockholm where social gatherings, sports activities and interesting training opportunities are business as usual.

* Experience from agile delivery models, e.g., SAFe or more traditional project models.
* Management of technical deliveries, potentially in software development, platform implementation or cloud infrastructure.

**Who is Stelltec:** 




  





 Stelltec is a consulting company focused on IT delivery management, founded in 2022.  Our team brings vast experience, deep knowledge and thorough understanding of what it takes to drive software, platform and technology implementations to successful completion. Stelltec has the skills our clients need to gain momentum, drive business value and achieve great results by enabling their tech organization to succeed.
 



 We’ll make it stellar. Together.
 



  





 We review applications continuously and look forward to your application!

title: Group Technical Services Manager
description:
*Early 2024, EQT and Adelis took a decisive step to jointly invest in HVD Group, further expanding our fantastic group with the addition of Next One Technology and Craftnote. HVD group provides cloud-based software to customers working in the field of installation and construction across Europe, offering modern solutions to an entire industry in dire need of digitalisation. Our mission is to enable and drive an industry transformation, enhancing efficiency and sustainability for all customer segments- one business at a time!*
**Role Description**
 We are looking for an experienced Technical Services Manager to lead our technical services team and work to make our software products the best for our customers. As the group manager, you’ll be responsible for overseeing the technical internal support, maintenance, and professional services team consisting of Subject Matter Experts and dedicated internal support resources, and will work closely with the product management, engineering, and sales teams to ensure that our products are of the highest quality.
   

  

**What You’ll Get To Do**
* Work directly with C-level for strategic Technical Support definitions
* Lead and develop the technical services team, including technical internal support and professional services team.
* Work with sales’ and consultants' teams to create and maintain maintaining knowledge base (digital, forums, webinars, educational workshops etc.)
* Define and manage internal and external SLAs for 2nd line support.
* Implement best practices for technical services, and continuously improve our processes.
* Provide technical support and assistance to internal and external stakeholders, and work with them to resolve any issues they may have.
* Lead release management from a quality perspective, defining test protocol scope, development support, resourcing and infrastructure needs. Plan and manage CCB meetings (Change Control Board).
* Manage relationships with key partners and vendors that provide critical technical services.
* Work with the sales team to identify and close new business opportunities in the technical services area including support in customer meetings and onboarding process.
* Create and maintain statistical data on product usage, feature usage and bug frequency.
* Manage the technical services budget and ensure that resources are allocated effectively including line management, developing and creating KPI’s to follow progress and improvement.


 ,
   

  

* 10+ years of experience in technical services, with at least 3 years of experience in a leadership role.
* Strong knowledge of agile software development and product management processes
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to lead and motivate a team, always working towards building a good and strong culture
* Excellent communication skills in English, a Nordic language is meriting.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.
* Experience with customer service and support.
* Strong drive to learn of industry trends and developments in the technical services area.


 If you share our enthusiasm and vision but worry that your experience does not match all the specified qualifications, apply anyway! You may be the ideal candidate for this role or another in our ever-growing organization.

title: Web Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. Doesn't matter if you are in the beginning or in the peak of your career - we invite you to apply! The role is relatively broad and focused on web technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern web stack technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Web Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Use modern frontend frameworks such as NextJS, Svelte, and Flutter to create amazing digital experiences.
* Engaging with backend languages and frameworks like Go, Rust, and Kotlin to craft scalable integration middle layers.
* Working with contemporary SaaS headless CMS and E-commerce platforms including Centra, Shopify, and MedusaJS.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organizations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Integrations Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about AI and eager to work on groundbreaking projects? Do you want to be a part of a rock-star team in a promising startup, collaborate with industry leaders and make a real impact in the legal landscape? Here's your chance!
   

  

 You will
   

  

* Architect and implement features and improvements across our data pipelines and integrations with file management platforms
* Monitor and ensure that all integrations are running smoothly
* Take ownership of our integrations, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Helping break down tasks and ensure their effective execution
* Work with some of the latest technologies and some of the smartest engineers in the industry
* Be challenged and grow very quickly as a developer


 Who you are
   

  

* Skilled: You have a proven track record of developing reliable data pipelines and integrations to various systems and you are not afraid of responsibility for important and mission-critical software.
* Innovative: You thrive in a dynamic start-up environment where problems don’t always have obvious or easy solutions. You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about data and architecture. You are curious and passionate about writing good software, and you’re ambitious about learning and improving yourself as an engineer.
* Autonomous: Although constantly working in a team we believe in self leadership and ownership! You value feedback, take initiative without needing direction, and focus on outcomes. You are not afraid to try new things and learn from your mistakes rather than play it safe.
* Entrepreneurial: Leya is an ambitious start-up. Things move fast, tasks and challenges may be demanding, and responsibilities may change over time. But you’ll get to work with a team of brilliant and dedicated people that are all working to solve difficult problems and really change how legal work is done.


**About Leya**
 We’re a (growing!) team of hackers, designers, researchers, and more tech people excited about using cutting-edge tech & AI to transform how people work.
   

  

 In just one year, we’ve transformed from three friends building something cool for the legal industry to collaborating with Europe's top law firms and legal departments. With backing from some of the best VCs in the world, Benchmark and Y-Combinator, (other investments: Stripe, Airbnb, Algolia, Reddit, Dropbox etc) we have enough money to really invest in building the best tech team in the world.
   

  

**Practical Information**
* You’ll get a competitive salary, and you’ll get to own part of the company via stock options
* Office in central Stockholm
* Primarily on-site – some flexibility :)
* We use English for internal communication
* Start date: ASAP


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 2+ years writing data pipelines with Python, SQL and some modern orchestration tool
* 2+ years of building integrations with document systems like Sharepoint, iManage, Google Drive etc
* Python
* SQL


**Additional Experience That’s a Plus**
* IaC (Pulumi or Terraform)
* CI/CD pipelines
* Azure or AWS
* Elasticsearch and Postgres
* Kubernetes


 We founded Leya with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Leya for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The world is changing in the way we consume products, from ownership to usership, and DigitalRoute is positioned in the centre of the transition. Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real time and at high scale.
 



  





 As a senior and experienced Software Engineer at DigitalRoute, you will immediately play an important role in the development of our SaaS offering, a multi-tenant cloud service called Usage Engine Cloud Edition. This product is growing quickly. We are already processing billions of events per month and some very well-known companies are coming on board right now.
 



  





 You will not just be another person in a sea of people - you will be influencing things like software design, scalability, performance, maintainability and quality.
 



 Your expertise and your experience will be instrumental in helping us stay ahead and have a competitive edge in the market. Active collaboration across teams and professions is natural in DR, we know you like that as well.
 



  





**What** 
 you'll do
 


* You will be working in one of our four SaaS engineering teams, where people really enjoy collaborating and will welcome you with open arms!
* You will be building a product where things like scalability, security, transaction safety, and high throughput are key. Some very well-known companies will use what you create!
* The product is cloud-native and multi-tenant; running on AWS, using tech like Node, Typescript, Kubernetes, Kafka and AWS services. We continuously improve things.
* Naturally, you will have influence in discussions about software design and architecture.
* Your input on how to do all this in a lean, agile and efficient way is also very welcome.



  





**What** 
 you'll bring
 


* Professional experience and seniority.
* Strong and proven tech skills; likely with most of these: Java, Node.js, TypeScript, AWS, Kubernetes, Azure, GCP.
* Deep experience with Microservice architectures & event-driven architectures, as well as Kafka or some other distributed event streaming platform.
* Database skills plus experience from handling huge amounts of transactions.
* Plenty of experience and opinions on software architecture & design.
* Quality thinking, based on care for the customers, design, release processes, testing and more.
* Teamwork preference – you enjoy helping others understand, grow and perform.
* Communication skills; you can explain things both with and without all the details.
* Experience working with (and improving) agile team processes.



  





 We apply continuous selection, and the position may be filled before the last application date.
 



  





 DigitalRoute wants to be part of an inclusive and diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths.
 



  





 We Look forward to your application!

title: Master thesis-mplementing and Scaling the Industrial Internet of Things
description:
**Background:**
 At Scania, we want to set the next step towards the digitalisation in our factories. Our This consists of building a smart factory digital ecosystem, combining the physical equipment and our digital systems and unifying the different sources of data.
   

  

 The Smart Factory Lab at Scania is an experimental test environment that explores, assesses, and pilots new technologies before they are adopted in Scania’s production processes. The lab focuses on digitalization and automation with the target of achieving autonomous material handling, reduction of quality deviations, and shortened introduction time. This will increase safety, productivity, quality, and human well-being. We are looking for motivated and creative students to join our Smart Factory Lab for their master thesis.
   

  

 The thesis will involve working on innovative projects that explore how emerging technologies can enhance our production, engineering, and collaboration processes. You will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment, where you can test and validate new technologies, methods, and solutions in close collaboration with our internal and external stakeholders.
   

  

**Topics include:**
* Industrial Internet of Things
* Industry 4.0 (I4.0) / Fourth Industrial Revolution (4IR)
* Software Architecture
* Manufacturing Systems
* System Integrations
* Unified Namespace (UNS)
* Cloud/Edge Computing


**Assignment:**
 Exact details for the assignment are open for discussion. We propose one of the following topics for the project:
   

  

  

* Pre-study for the implementation of IIoT at one of our production units. We have a need for IIoT at one of Scania’s machining production units for a business case. One big issue that we run in at this production unit is collecting and understanding data from different sources. This assignment focuses on doing study on how we can organize and structure the data flow to build a solid foundation.
* Applied Metadata for IIoT. Investigate how to apply IIoT-standards on real-time data in the existing ecosystem. Suggest improvements and test new tools for achieving the expected result. Perform a gap analysis on existing standards and vocabularies from traditional IIoT ontologies compared to what is needed in Scania’s industrial context.
* Comparing the ISA-95 standard to Scania’s Common Information Model. This assignment will dive deeper in data modelling to combine industry standards, such as ISA-95, and in-house data models.
* Depending on the ability to support, we can discuss alternatives.


**Education and time plan:**
 Education: Master’s program in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Automation Engineering, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or Cloud Computing
   

  

 Number of students: 1-2
   

  

 Start date: January 2025
   

  

 Estimated time needed: 20 weeks
   

  

**Contact persons and supervisor:**
 Maarten van Ittersum, maarten.van.ittersum@scania.com
   

  

**Application:**
 Your application must include a CV, personal letter and transcript of grades
   

  

**A background check might be conducted for this position. We are conducting interviews continuously and may close the recruitment earlier than the date specified.**

description:

The new hybrid working creates totally new needs and your innovations will help millions of users worldwide to get a fantastic work life.
