You are open-minded, curious, and love learning new things. You enjoy discussing and sharing knowledge. We also believe you are a person who appreciates working in a smaller team where you have great opportunities to shape the overall system.

title: Master's Thesis: The feasibility of evasion attacks against ML-based NIDSs
description:
Master's Thesis: The feasibility of evasion attacks against ML-based NIDSs
   

  

**Background**
 Machine learning-based Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) are commonly employed to monitor network traffic and detect suspicious activities that could signal a potential cyber-attack. These systems can be tailored to identify specific types of threats, issuing alerts, and even taking automated actions to block attacks or isolate compromised devices. By utilizing IDS, organizations and service providers can safeguard their networks from various cyber threats, ensuring the protection of their devices and data. However, ML-based IDSs themselves can become targets of attacks. For instance, adversarial attacks that create instances designed to bypass detection, known as model evasion attacks, are a growing concern.
   

  

**Thesis Description**
 This project aims to investigate the feasibility of model evasion attacks against ML-based IDSs. While previous studies have highlighted the vulnerability of ML-based IDS to adversarial samples, these samples are often generated based on extracted network traffic features, making them impractical for real-world deployment. To address this limitation, this research will explore the practical simulation of adversarial network traffic, aiming to understand its characteristics and assess the effectiveness of model evasion attacks in realistic scenarios.
   

  

 RISE will provide the necessary background information and guidance throughout the completion of the master thesis. The student's tasks for this project will include:
   

  

* Conducting a comprehensive study on state-of-the-art techniques of model evasion attack on ML-based IDSs.
* Assessing the effectiveness of the adversarial samples to the ML-based IDS.
* Design and implement novel techniques to craft adversarial samples that can practically evade the ML-based IDSs.
* Conducting experimental evaluations of the developed solutions in a laboratory environment.
* Documenting all activities and outcomes of the research in the form of a comprehensive thesis report.


**Student profile**
 We are looking for an ambitious MSc student who has fulfilled the course requirements. Good programming skills in Python are required, as is good spoken and written English. Experience with machine learning and network security is a plus. Applications should include a brief personal statement, a CV, and a list of grades. The application has to mention previous activities or other projects that are relevant for the position.
   

  

 This thesis will be conducted within the RISE Cybersecurity Unit in Kista, Stockholm.
   

  

 Candidates are encouraged to send their application as soon as possible. Suitable applicants will be interviewed as applications are received. A successful candidate will have the opportunity to contribute to European Research & Development security projects.
   

  

**About Us**
 RISE Research Institutes of Sweden AB is a research organization owned by the Swedish government. This thesis will be conducted within the RISE Cybersecurity Unit, which is among the largest publicsector cybersecurity research groups in Sweden. Our core areas of expertise are: IoT Security, Cloud Security, Network & Communication Security, Access Control, Privacy (technical and social aspects), and Secure Virtualization and Trusted Computing. The RISE Cybersecurity Unit is the European leader in IoT security research & development. In additional to a strong research environment, RISE
   

  

 Cybersecurity is the owner of the RISE Cyber Range, a cybersecurity test and demo facility in Kista with a critical infrastructure grade security, that provides a trusted place for Swedish industry to understand and address their cybersecurity needs. RISE Cyber Range, in addition to providing practical cybersecurity education, training and exercise, is an environment for state-of-the-art cybersecurity research and development.
   

  

**Welcome with your application**
 If you want to know more, please contact Han Wang (han.wang@ri.se). Last day of application is

title: Master's Thesis Student (30 hp) in Computer Vision - Fault Detection Using AI
description:
Scania is leading the shift towards a sustainable transport system, creating mobility solutions that benefit businesses, society, and the environment. As part of this mission, our department plays a vital role in ensuring that vehicles are maintained, diagnosed, and upgraded in a high-quality, cost-effective manner.
   

  

**About Us**
 We are an innovative, driven, and highly skilled team, passionate about leveraging AI for real-world applications. Our team consists of Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and Cloud Engineers, all collaborating to develop state-of-the-art AI models. Our achievements have already positioned us as a leader in AI and data-driven innovation, and we are now looking to further advance our research and development by welcoming a
 **Master’s Thesis Student** 
 to explore novel AI solutions in computer vision.
   

  

**Thesis Project Overview**
 In this master’s thesis, you will explore the use of computer vision to detect faulty parts, cracks, leakages, and other anomalies in vehicle components, directly supporting Scania's commitment to vehicle quality and sustainability.
   

  

 Your research will focus on developing, implementing, and evaluating advanced object detection techniques for fault detection in vehicle maintenance contexts. Key areas of focus will include:
   

  

  

* Developing and fine-tuning models (e.g., YOLO) for detecting defects such as cracks, leaks, or wear in vehicle parts.
* Exploring Vision-Language Models (VLMs) as a means of identifying and describing deviations in component conditions.
* Optimizing data collection and annotation processes, focusing on improving training data quality for real-time applications.


**What You Will Learn**
* Advanced object detection methodologies and their application in real-time environments.
* Handling and processing large-scale video streams and images for training AI models.
* Exploration of Vision-Language Models for automatic description and categorization of defects.
* Working in an Agile environment and collaborating with multidisciplinary teams within Scania.


**Our Ideal Candidate**
 We are seeking a Master's student in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Vision, or a related field. You should possess knowledge or experience in:
   

  

  

* Python programming and cloud services like AWS.
* Machine learning algorithms and deep learning concepts.
* Image and video processing techniques, especially for object detection.
* An interest in applying AI to detect anomalies such as cracks, leakages, or wear in vehicle parts.


 A structured, communicative, and collaborative mindset will ensure you thrive in our supportive and dynamic team. Fluency in English is required.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 At Scania, you’ll find an inspiring workplace with ample opportunities for personal and professional growth. You’ll be supported throughout your thesis journey by experienced colleagues, working closely with cutting-edge technology in a real-world setting.
   

  

**Contact Information**
 For more details about this thesis opportunity, please contact supervisor Olof Steinert, Strategic Product Planning and Advanced Analytics (EYSFS), olof.steinert@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Number of students: 1-2 (you can apply separately or together)
   

  

 Start date: Spring 2025
   

  

 Estimated time needed: 20 weeks, Full-time
   

  

 To apply, please send your CV, a cover letter detailing your interest in the project, and any relevant certificates. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, with a final deadline of 2024-11-24.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position. We are conducting interviews continuously and may close the recruitment earlier than the date specified.
   

  

 Master’s Thesis Student (30 hp) in Computer Vision – Fault Detection Using AI

title: Master's Thesis: On-device Learning for resource-constrained IoT devices
description:
Master's Thesis: On-device Learning for resource-constrained IoT devices
   

  

 We have an open position for a dedicated master student to join us at the Connected Intelligence research unit, within the Computer Science department at RISE.
   

  

**Background and Purpose**
 Machine learning (ML) has catalyzed the design and development of various intelligent systems over wide application domains. Many efforts have been made to deploy ML models on resource-constrained devices as well. More recently, the concept of on-device learning (ODL) has gained attention, which means performing both inference and training on local devices. Local devices mostly refer to resource-constrained devices, ranging from smartphones to low-power IoT devices. For example, low-power IoT devices are normally only equipped with memory in the kilobyte range, which brings challenges to the feasibility of ODL. Meanwhile, ODL also comes with the following two main benefits: firstly, ODL alleviates data drift via online adaptation for different deployment scenarios. Secondly, ODL preserves privacy, saves bandwidth, and reduces latency and energy since there is no need to upload data to the cloud and/or download an updated model back.
   

  

**Thesis Description**
 The thesis will focus on investigating the performance, power consumption, memory usage, and computing resources usage of the ODL system on resource-constraint IoT devices. After a thorough literature review of related research works, an ODL system will be designed, implemented, and evaluated.
   

  

 Terms:
   

  

 Start time: as soon as possible.
   

  

 Scope: 30hp (20 weeks)
   

  

 Location: RISE Computer Science, Stockholm (Kista). Options to partially work remotely.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We expect you to have good programming skills with C/C++, experience in applying machine learning models, and an interest/curiosity in IoT and embedded systems.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 To know more, please contact Prof. Thiemo Voigt (thiemo.voigt@ri.se), and Shuai Zhu (shuai.zhu@ri.se). Applications should include a brief personal letter, CV, recent grades, and a code example. Candidates are encouraged to send in their application as soon as possible but at the latest by the 15th of October 2024. Suitable applicants will be interviewed as soon as applications are received.
   

  

 Keywords: Master thesis, Machine Learning, On-device learning, IoT, RISE, Stockholm

title: Senior .NET/Integration Specialists
description:
Job Title: Senior .NET / Azure Integration Developer/Specialist
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Job Type: Full-Time
   

  

 About Us:
   

  

 We are a leading technology-driven company at the forefront of innovation, providing cutting-edge solutions to a diverse range of industries. Based in Stockholm, we are looking for an experienced and highly skilled Senior .NET / Azure Integration Developer/Specialist to join our dynamic team. If you're passionate about cloud technologies, enjoy working on complex integration projects, and want to make an impact within a progressive environment, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain .NET-based applications and services, with a focus on integrating Microsoft Azure solutions.
* Lead the architecture and development of Azure cloud integration's, ensuring seamless connectivity between on-premises and cloud-based systems.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable and efficient integration solutions.
* Utilize Azure services such as Azure Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, and API Management to build and optimize integrations.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex integration issues, ensuring the stability and performance of systems.
* Drive best practices for cloud architecture, security, and performance optimization within the organization.
* Mentor junior developers and provide technical leadership on integration projects.


 Requirements:
   

  

* A good few years of experience with .NET development, including C# and ASP.NET.
* Proven experience in Azure cloud services, specifically in integration projects using Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, API Management, and Service Bus.
* Strong understanding of cloud architecture, microservices, and serverless computing.
* Hands-on experience with RESTful APIs, web services, and middleware technologies.
* Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools such as Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Excellent communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus).
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.


 What We Offer:
   

  

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* A flexible and innovative work environment with a focus on work-life balance.
* The chance to work on exciting projects with leading-edge technologies.
* An inclusive, supportive, and collaborative team culture.


 How to Apply:
   

  

 If you are a seasoned .NET/Azure specialist looking for your next challenge in Stockholm, we would love to hear from you! Please send your CV and apply within!

title: Erfaren systemarkitekt till Excillum!
description:
Vill du arbeta med företaget bakom världens mest avancerade industriella röntgenkälla? Perfekt, då har du kommit rätt! Excillum grundades 2007 av forskare från Kungliga Tekniska högskolan (KTH) och är idag ledande inom området för avancerade röntgenkällor. Här får du arbeta i ett ödmjukt och hjälpsamt företagsklimat med stöttande och engagerade kollegor. Vi söker dig med flerårig erfarenhet inom systemarkitektur och som vill vara ledande i arbetet med att ta Excillums produkter till nästa nivå! Är det du? Läs vidare!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Excillum Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Kista
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Excillum designar, utvecklar och tillverkar röntgenkällor som bland annat används för kvalitetssäkring inom halvledar-, elektronik- och batteritillverkning. Andra tillämpningar är för framtagande av nya läkemedel och möjliggörande av helt ny banbrytande forskning inom t.ex. biologi, medicin och materialvetenskap. Sedan starten 2007 har Excillum växt och är idag runt 80 medarbetare i Stockholm. Rollen som systemarkitekt är ny och du kommer ha möjlighet att vara med och påverka utformningen av den. Arkitektarbetet på Excillum handlar om att skapa sig en förståelse för vilka moduler som finns inom mekanik, hur de interagerar med elektroniken och i sin tur hur det fungerar ihop med mjukvaran för att säkerställa att hela systemet hänger ihop. Bolaget karaktäriseras av en stark ingenjörskultur och du samarbetar tätt tillsammans med experter inom exempelvis mekanik, elektronik, mjukvara, system test, forskare, produktion och sälj. Excillum har huvudkontor i Kista med både labb och produktion i huset vilket gör att du kommer att arbeta nära produkterna du utvecklar.
 


  


  

**Några ord från din framtida närmsta chef**



  


 "Hej! Jag heter Nina och började på Excillum för 4 år sedan. Här har jag mötts av passionerade kollegor, produkter med outforskade tekniska möjligheter och ett företag som strävar efter att vara världsledande inom sitt område. Som chef vill jag ge dig möjlighet att prova dina egna idéer och arbetssätt. Jag vill vara ditt bollplank när vi utforskar olika vägar framåt och ge dig det stöd du behöver. Rollen som Systemarkitekt är ny hos oss, vilket kräver kunskap och driv hos dig men också ger stora möjligheter att påverka Excillum framåt. Om du vill ha ett jobb där du arbetar mitt i centrum av tekniskt avancerade produkter så har du här en fantastisk möjlighet att göra skillnad!”
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att jobba med de absoluta experterna inom såväl röntgen som elektronik och mekanik, mjukvara och produktledning
  
* Möjligheten att kliva in i en ny roll där du kommer få påverka och tycka till om hur ni jobbar
  
* Arbete i ett företag med en vänskaplig och hjälpsam företagskultur
  


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Som System Arkitekt är du dels delaktig i att sätta den tekniska road mapen för system plattformen, du ansvarar för att systemdesignen är modulär, har tydliga gränssnitt och att delarna i produkterna kan återanvändas. Excillum har ett stort fokus på att göra industriella designval och här kommer du vara en viktig speaking partner till produktchefer, mjukvaruarkitekterna och röntgenspecialister. Du kommer med det tekniska systemperspektivet och har förståelsen kring vad produkten kan göra, hur den skulle kunna utvecklas och att alla jobbar mot ett gemensamt mål. Du kommer på sikt även att leda arkitektforum, leda den tekniska kravspecifikationen och genomföra riskanalyser samt ha en viktig roll i arbetet med att säkerställa systematik i utvecklingen av produkterna och motivera och förklara de tekniska besluten.
 


  


 Vidare kommer du…
 


  

  
* Granska projektdokumentation (ex. teststrategier, testplaner, manualer och instruktioner)
  
* Sätta dig in i hur våra röntengenkällor fungerar teoretiskt och praktiskt
  
* Supportera compliance-tester
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dig som person och ditt intresse för rollen och Excillum som bolag. Du är en person med en stark förmåga att samarbeta med olika team, kunder och externa parter och du har en öppen approach och är duktig på att kommunicera och vågar utmana tidigare arbetssätt.
 


  


 Vidare har du…
 


  

  
* Minst en civilingenjörsexamen inom mekatronik, fysik, elektronik eller motsvarande
  
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av liknande uppgifter där du jobbat med högteknologiska produkter innehållande både hård- och mjukvara
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska
  


  


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har…
 


  

  
* Kunskaper i svenska
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Placering: Kista, Stockholm och möjlighet till visst distansarbete
  
* Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och Excillums önskan är att alla frågor går till Academic Work
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  
* Vi arbetar med löpande urval, sök tjänsten så snart du kan om du är intresserad.
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Excillum Aktiebolag**

 Läs mer om Excillum på deras hemsida: https://www.excillum.com/
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Excillum Aktiebolag**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johanna Sörell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107445

title: Power System Engineer within Renewable Energy Integration
description:
**Description**


Seize this opportunity to take on a highly visible position in a global organization. As a Power System Engineer within Renewable Energy Integration you will belong to Power Consulting, a department within Hitachi Energy working with both internal and external clients in the energy sector. You will be part of a renowned global team of power system and energy consultants. In the role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the green transition and create a more sustainable energy future for all.


So, if you want to take the next step in your career, and contribute to develop a stronger, smarter, and greener energy system – Join us now! We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join it!

**Your responsibilities**

* In this exciting role, you will get the opportunity to take part in major assignments related to the green energy transition together with our consultants and experts from local as well as international Power Consulting offices.
* The assignments for the role are mainly system studies within the area of renewable energy integration but could also be related to HVDC, FACTS, green hydrogen and power systems in general.
* Cooperation and work in teams with leading specialists together with Hitachi Energy well-defined career path ensures exciting and motivating career with fast development along own interests and personality traits.
* You will be living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

 **Your background**

* You hold a Master’s degree in electrical engineering, electrical power systems or similar.
* You have a great interest and preferably a couple of years of experience in the consulting and energy sector.
* Knowledge in power systems analysis and in software simulation tools such as PSS/E, PSCAD and/or DIgSILENT PowerFactory.
* Programming skill in Python, C++, etc. is a merit.
* You have an analytical mindset, you are independent, self-going and take your own initiatives to solve problems.
* As a person, you are collaborative and communicative.
* It is necessary to be fluent in English. Swedish is meritorious.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**More about us**


The position is based in Gothenburg or Stockholm (Solna).


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!


Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager, Gustavo Pinares, gustavo.pinares@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner, Tobias Nilsson, tobias.n.nilsson@hitachienergy.com.

title: Test Engineer for Electronics at ABB Process Automation
description:
**Test Engineer for Electronics at ABB Process Automation**
===========================================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **This position reports to**


Industrial Engineer (DFX Expert)

### **Your role and responsibilities**


We are looking for a Test Engineer for electronics to start working as part of our Process Control Platform (PCP), a unit within ABB’s business area Process Automation. PCP develops automation products - hardware and software - for monitoring, process control and optimization. We have automation products for all kind of industries. As a Test Engineer for electronics, you will be responsible for monitoring, challenging and increasing ABB supplier’s production performance mostly in product testing area by developing ABB products testing solutions and adopting those to industry producibility standards. Key interaction areas are maintaining and controlling ABB production test equipment at our suppliers (working in TestStand, understanding ABB product communication and supporting creation and acceptance of various testers (programming, ICT, Hi-Pot, functional test), monitoring suppliers performance and working together with them to increase it, collaboration with other ABB functions to launch and ramp-up production at Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) plants (ex. participating in quality audits, driving NPI (new product introduction) process, etc., challenging suppliers in cost optimization, working with EMS companies to ensure continuous production flow and non-disrupted process and operations). Examples of responsibilities include: • Driving test equipment development, ordering and validation process • Product test specification reviews with R&D (preferred) • Coaching suppliers about ABB production requirements, as well as supporting the internal R&D department with production test strategy, plan and procedures • Following design guidelines and standards (design for excellence criteria) • Controlling investment for new/updated products • Working in close collaboration with Supplier Quality, R&D, Planning and Fulfillment team, Procurement and Logistics teams • ABB asset database management • Support continuous improvement projects at EMS • Following Lean Six Sigma as the leading principle Test Engineer for electronics is a key element in PCP hardware value chain to drive quality and performance of technical solution and production, hence a key element to positive business development and customer satisfaction. Join us in this position and help us on this development journey!


### **Qualifications for the role**

* Around 3 years of experience in hardware development or Test engineer for electronics, Test Engineering or Test Design at EMS
* Knowledge in hardware design and production processes
* Basic knowledge of LabView and/or TestStand is preferrable
* Professional expertise in Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) or introduction of new products in mass production, or similar
* Good communication skills and a team player
* Good oral and written English
* Strong quality mindset – with a strive for perfection and an open and global mindset
* Knowledge of IPC electronics standards is beneficial

### **More about us**


Recruiting Manager Martynas Gedgaudas, +37 066 54 86 13, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85. Talent Partner: Johannes Westermark Hester. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory Apply at the latest by 14th October. Please note that interviews are held on an ongoing basis, apply today to secure your spot in the recruitment process! Please note that, to be eligible for employment at ABB AB, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test and could also include a background check. We kindly decline any direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.

title: Power Electrical Engineer to Västerås
description:
